Honestly, the best part of my meal was the french fries. They were so crunchy and golden, just like I prefer them. If it weren't for the french fries and the exceptional service, I likely would have given this place lower stars. So thank you Bronson for your excellent service and patience with my family...and PBR do NOT change your french fries!!

*2017 Yelp Review Challenge: 1/100*

If you are staying at Planet Hollywood, PBR serves a decent breakfast that's not horribly overpriced.  

GOOD: Three eggs (not just your usual two) cooked overeasy and thcik cut baked cooked just right are perfect for offsetting last night's booze.  

BAD: The service here was pretty slow - seriously, how long does it take to make eggs and bacon and fry tater tots?  Also, there' s not choice of bacon or sausage just bacon.

UGLY: They were blaring rap and R&B before noon.  Isn't this supposed to be a country joint?!  Gimme my George Strait.
Sat outside.  Unique space heaters.  Food was OK, servings plentiful.  Waitstaff pleasant.

This place has changed so much since it first opened. The bad part, all my favorite items are off the menu. The only thing remaining is the Doritos Mac n cheese and it wasn't the same today. :(

Most of the staff I've encountered hasn't been friendly and it's expensive. So you're paying a lot for less than average good and poor service. It's a shame because I used to love this place! (As you can see in my previous review) 

Sadly, I won't be returning.

went there for breakfast outside and sat by the street traffic.  it was great...good food and a wonderful waitress who i can't remember the name of!  we didn't look inside until we went into the mall and this place is HUGE!  went back later in the afternoon and had a beer outside again.  loved the place!

The hostess who seated me and my friends was very friendly and welcoming. After ten minutes we got water. Then for the next 20 minutes we were on our own. Ended up leaving and eating somewhere else. A shame as I've heard good things about the burgers and have been dying to try one. Hunger won out today. Had to leave and eat.
Food was amazing. The atmosphere was really good if you want to do something a little different then the normal Vegas place. The Bbq burger is delicious

We were able to sit on the patio to watch our team's basketball game which was nice they accommodated us by turning it on. Drinks were priced as you would expect for Vegas and the appetizers were nice. The waitress was friendly and helpful.

One star because of the ambiance..  Otherwise zero stars...  Country bar that's packed and lively so you think the food would be good. Also has a mechanical bull. 

Food was not only NOT good...  It was way overpriced and came out ice cold. We wanted to return it but the waiter (woods was last name on receipt) didn't come back the entire meal and the food took almost 30 minutes to get there in the first place.   We both ordered the $25 combo plates w Mac n cheese and fries as side. Dorito crusted Mac n cheese would have been better if they'd used kraft out of the box. Gross.   The ribs and brisket were both very subpar. Friend got the chicken that was dry and cold.    

Bill was $52...  Not the biggest issue with losing the money but more with losing the opportunity to eat at a GOOD Vegas restaurant...  And they are everywhere

I'm just gonna throw this out there because I could not find an answer anywhere.. it's $5 to ride the bull but you get a free ride when you dine in or with some "liquid courage." Now on to the review..

We've been here probably 3-4 times, and there's a reason we keep coming back! Good food, fun atmosphere, and we always leave with leftovers! Is it a little pricey? Of course it is, you're in Vegas on the strip! What did you expect? 

We had tempura pickles (fried pickles) as an appetizer and they were great! So were the chips that came with it! The buffalo chicken flatbread was great, more than enough for one person! My parents had burgers and they said they were fantastic!

Also, if you do ride the bull, fully expect a nice bruise on your thigh to appear by the next day  but still a fun experience and worth it!
Service was pretty slow. Menu was okay. Everything else was just average. There are better places to go to on the Strip.

I'm here everytime I visit Las Vegas (and I'm here often) I absolutely love it. The bartenders are always friendly the food is awesome I've had wings and burgers here. The atmosphere is amazing highly recommend This place for sure

Roaming down the strip with drink in hand - my roomie & i went all the way from TI/Mirage to PH/Aria. Naturally, parts of it were a blur, but all I can distinctively remember is my Napolean Dynamite-intense craving for tater tots. In my desperation, I practically asked every restaurant on the side of the strip if they served tater tots. 

But, we finally meandered our way to PH and found the ROCK BAR. My roomie knew of this place because she likes that the alcoholic slushies in the guitar/bud light containers. But, we didn't know they had food. Asked if they had tater tots, answered yes, & we were SOLD - or at least I was. 

And from my fuzzy memory, I recall a giant glorious basket of deep fried golden-brown perfection. I really don't think anyone should have that much starch + deep fried food in a 15 minute window. But, I snarfed those puppies down (smothered in ketchup of course) with the utmost satisfaction. 

Rockbar has a plethora of drunchie/bar finger food. Yumm-o.

The atmosphere is a bar of loud 70s rock music. We had good service with several check ins. I ordered buffalo wings, while they had a good flavor, they were not spicy. The California sandwich is really good and i would recommend it.
Swung by for drinks, cool ambiance. Plenty of TVs, great bartenders. It's very big and has a mini shopping area at the front of the main entrance.

Pretty decent place to grab some food on the strip. The service and food were good. The sweet potato tots were my favorite!! I can't say anything about their drinks as I had water, but that was actually pretty good considering most restaurants I've had to actually order a drink Bc the water was so yucky. The servers were pretty cool and accommodating when I needed to charge my phone and didn't have an outlet they offered to charge it by the dj booth. Overall I had a good experience... may be back if I remember next time I'm on the strip!

Fantastic for what it is!  Perfect for brunch. 

Hungry for brunch - hung over!?  Get the egg sandwich. Egg cheese. Ham. Sausage. Bacon  on two waffles with syrup. 

The pulled pork is also amazing and they have great bloodies

Always stop by PBR during my visits to Vegas. Located in the Miracle Mile Shops on the strip. Had the PBR Burger, fries and a beer. Very satisfying as it was my first go-to spot arriving in Vegas. 

Never too crowded, good service, good food, decent prices, TV's to watch games and big time sporting events. Glad PBR has stayed around for all these years.

My girlfriends smoked salmon in and it was raw in the middle. My other friend had pizza and the dough was raw inside. I told a waitress about it and she said she will tell our main waitress about the problem. We waited for a while and realized she didn't tell her. So I went up to our main waitress and she apologized and offered a replace or a substitution. My fish and chips were just nasty. Amateur line cooks?
Service was poor at the beginning but then it improved dramatically, cant blame the waitress since she had her hands full serving other patrons. Food acceptable, can see myself going back.

Holy hell. The quesadilla is spicy! If you are white, you can not handle this. 

Open bar only applies to the left side of the bar (bull free). 

Keep in mind it's 1am as I write this review. I can't eat enough to replace the 1 Fat Tuesday drink I consumed and OMG my mouth is on fire from the quesadilla.

A sports bar atmosphere on the strip! At lunch we all had burgers fries wings and things and of course brews! Haven't had a PBR since my HS party days many years ago when pounders were invented! But it's a sports party bar on the strip with a party menu! Great lunch sit outside watch people walk by and enjoy your lunch! Did I mention it's a sports bar bar atmosphere?enjoy It's Vegas!

The bar is not a country bar. They seem to be confused. PBR is traditionally a country bar; however the venue is also called the rock bar and plays hiphop music. If your looking to line dance and listen to your favorite country songs this is not the place.
Centrally located with nice atmosphere. It was a perfect mid day stop after walking the entire strip. Friendly staff and fast service.
I ate at PBR on Monday 3-12-18.  The menu selections is wide open and so is the alcohol choices!  A very fun, festive atmosphere.  I'd go again the next time I'm in town.

Never again. We sat and nobody came to help us so we moved to the bar. We asked them to put the fight on the tvs. That took at least 30 minutes so we missed quite a bit of it. When we ordered, half of the things we wanted weren't available. If it was slammed and busy I would be more understanding, but that wasn't the case. I would not recommend you bring your Vegas experience here.

My boyfriend was craving a breakfast sandwich and I suggested checking out the Earl of Sandwich. Since we had already spent quite a bit on lunch the previous day, we were looking for a more affordable option. When we discovered that the Earl quit serving breakfast at noon (and it was 1 PM), we ended up across the way at PBR Rock Bar. Stumbling upon this ended up being a pretty good Vegas find. 

I figured that I had already eaten enough junk for a week in my first day at Vegas so I decided to be good and order a salad. As soon as I noticed that PBR offered half salad orders, I was completely sold. Thank you for offering an option for lighter eaters! I can never finish a full restaurant salad and not only do they not typically hold well as leftovers but many Vegas hotels don't offer refrigerators to store leftovers either. Finally, I can confidently order a salad and know that I won't be wasting half of it. Also, by ordering a half salad, my Country Fried Salad decreased from a ridiculous $17 to a much less intimidating $10. The salad is topped with chicken tenders, tomatoes and cheese and I asked for the cucumbers and bacon to be removed. I also asked for a side of ranch instead of having the salad tossed in honey mustard. I'm not a fan of pre-tossed salads as they tend to get soggy. Although I thought the ranch was quite good at first, it lost some of its appeal throughout the meal so I know it wasn't quite the normal restaurant quality ranch that I love. Even at a half size, I could still barely finish it and I can't imagine what a full-sized salad would look like. 

The Tex-Mex Scramble ended up catching my boyfriend's eye and he chose that over the intended breakfast sandwich. The eggs with pepper jack cheese were served with tater tots and toast and it seemed to hit the spot for him as a great hangover food option. 

I noticed when I checked in that they were offering a Yelp special of buy one, get one drinks. Since my boyfriend claims that beer helps him get over a hangover, he was more than happy to partake in this deal. 

Our waiter was a little odd and very chatty but I think he meant well. He seemed like the type to get nervous, such as when our food was taking awhile to come out, and then talk to much to overcompensate. 

We also had a photographer stop by our table to take pictures and then, of course, try to sell them to us. At first, she offered them for $20 for two framed photos. When we said no, she then offered just the photos for $10. Normally, I'd still say no but the photos were quite good and it was a vacation so I ended up taking her up on the deal and finding my own Vegas frame in the Miracle Mile Shops.

Overall, I was very pleased to find a spot on the Strip with at least some more affordable food options and I'd definitely considering returning on a future trip.

Came here for drinks one night. It was ladies night, so $1 drinks = PLUS!

I liked the ambience. It was fun watching drunk girls falling off the mechanical bull. LOL. The music was good. Very rock vibe, hence the name.

Came here again few days later for our last meal before heading to the airport. I had the pulled pork pizza. It was delicious but way too big for one person. 

My boyfriend had the Fried pickle burger. I had a bite of his and liked it, but he wasnt crazy about it. Our waitress was extremely nice though [forgot her name, but a very tall blonde]. She brought him 2 kinds of BBQ sauce, both of which he wasnt crazy about though. [Hes a chef and very picky!] All in all, a good experience though! Plus it was located right at our hotel, Planet Hollywood.

I wanted one of those ridiculously obnoxious touristy guitar drinks, but they were very pricey! [I think $35-38] Instead I walked to the casino where I got free drinks. LOL
Food was EH. Drinks were EH. Service was EH. Plenty places along the strip that are much better.

This girl was hungry... as usual.  Since we were out and about walking the strip, we decided on PBR.  Before we had lived here, we had dined with them before and loved it.  So let's try it again! 

We were greeted and seated immediately.  Kevin, our waiter, was over in a flash to get our drink order.  Let me just say that Kevin was an amazing waiter.  He was so attentive and friendly.  Our drinks were never empty and he was pleasant the entire time.   

Our food choices landed on the Buffalo Chicken Pizza and the Bucking Bull Fries.  We've previously had the pizza before and wanted to see if it was still to our liking.   Since the last visit, they changed it a little bit by sprinkling the blue cheese crumbles on top instead of the blue cheese sauce.  It wasn't as good as before but still ok.  The pizza itself is huge and can easily be spilt between two people... maybe even three.   We also split the fries which were completely covered by sauted onions, bacon, cheddar cheese sauce and buffalo hot sauce.  Delicious!  Very messy but we just ate them with forks.  Overall the food was still good enough to dine again.

Dinner and a show?  There is a mechanical bull in the restaurant.  It's free to ride with your paid receipt.  Would I try it?  Probably not but there are plenty of others who aren't afraid to!  We even witnessed a girl in a skirt ride the bull.  It is Vegas right?  This is so entertaining watching people attempt this craziness!  Plus there are tv's everywhere in the restaurant.  It is a great fun atmosphere.  :-)
Stopped by here after walking the strip aimlessly. I happened to arrive for the pre- Cinco de Mayo celebration. Wow, the food and the patio bar  service was great. Will definitely visit again.

This place rocks.  As good a sports bar as there is anywhere.  Lots of TV's, great bar scene, food is above average and the service is first rate.  You don't go there for gourmet meals, but for a sports bar, the food is well above average.

Lots of 20-30 something single girls, which truly makes this place a great sports bar.

You know it's bad when the worst decision I made in Vegas was going to PBR Rock Bar & Grill...

Besides taking forever to receive our food, it wasn't correct when it came out. I ordered a buffalo chicken pizza and was delivered a cheese pizza with pieces of chicken on it. After waiting 15 minutes to flag down my waitress and tell her it was the wrong order I was finally able to send it back to the kitchen for a new one. The server came back 10 minutes later with the SAME pizza and a side of buffalo sauce. I told him this pizza had tomato sauce on it and the one I ordered did not, it had buffalo sauce. Despite showing him the menu, he said the chef wouldn't make a different one. I was going to just suck it up and eat the pizza until I tried a bite of it and it was terrible. 

At that point I knew I didn't want it so I then had to wait another 15 minutes for the waitress to finally come back and tell her that I never got the right pizza. She agreed and I ordered a salad instead. Finally got the salad, and by that point my wife was completely done with her meal... which she thought was pretty terrible too.

Don't go here. Terrible service. Terrible food.

I made an outdoor reservation but was told there was no room outside. It was a beautiful day and wanted to people watch so I was disappointed about that. Other than that, the service was good. My son and his gf are vegans and they were more than happy to answer questions and ask the chef what they didn't know. Good food and a great music selection -just a little too loud to enjoy conversation.

Great food, great drinks awesome management team!!! Started off with sweet potato tots, this was a first for us they were delicious. I had a grilled chicken sandwich, my husband had a huge burger, it was outstanding. Management was on their game, made their rounds talking to tables. Our service was impeccable, we never had an empty glass. 
We will be returning, thanks guys!!
This place has a killer patio with strip view and great people watching.  You have to order the pulled pork nachos and the dorito crusted mac n cheese! !!!
Awesome joint. Great food. It was a great place to catch our breath after walking down the Strip.

This was our first stop in our plan for a progressive dinner on the Strip,and we stopped because we were really hungry and there was no wait for a table. The tables are huge and high, an uncomfortable combo for a shortie, but that's not what this is about. I ordered the meat pizza, a friend ordered the bacon mac and cheese and we talked our co-worker into trying the "largest burger," on the menu. It boasted to have lots of meat, a fried egg, bacon, cheese and hollandaise sauce. We started off the meal with fried pickles, which had a great crunch and a spicy kick at the end. They were delish. My pizza was not that exciting, or flavorful. It was sufficient, but I like when the cheese is carmelized a little, and this one fell a little short in flavor. The bacon mac and cheese was recommended by our friendly server, and proved to be the best thing that we ordered. The Big burger was reported to having a lack of flavor. He finished most of the burger, but said it didn't impress in flavor. All in all, the service was friendly, the food was sufficient, but not exciting or distinct enough for me to want to go back.

My best friend syed describes the sauce as having a "fervent after vomit taste"
My tater tots are microwaved
My eggs are cold
The pepper jack cheese is straight from a bag
The guacamole is brown

Do with this information what you will. I hope that I have herein been able to rescue you from one of life's small pains.

The waiter was inattentive and quite rude. He couldn't give me any answers when I asked about the yelp check in, "free drink," promo. He deferred me to the hostess station who also knew nothing and he kept diverting eye contact so I couldn't ask more questions. I got the chicken quesadilla and it was very bland and tasteless. My water cup sat empty for over half of my meal. He didn't act pleasant until the check came. To top it off, the hostess showed me how to get to the restroom and a staff member closed the door on my face, stating that it was undergoing repairs. I had to walk to the middle of planet hollywood to use the restroom. It was overall an awful experience. I would not recommend it.

Fun & loud place filled with lots of interesting people...

This place has a great design to it and a fun menu with really delicious creamy deviled eggs, mac & cheese coated with Doritos (wrong in all the right ways), fried pickles, decadent nachos, great spinach & artichoke dip and so many more fun plates! 

We came here as a large group and it was perfect for sharing a bunch of appetizers and delicious cocktails! They have cocktail bowls here that are massive and will f@$k you up! The Caribbean sunset one was my favorite, Malibu coconut rum, Bacardi and orange & pineapple juice! A tropical paradise in a cup or bowl...

If you want a loud spot with Rock & Roll blaring this is it! Bull riding anyone? This place has you covered. One cocktail bowl and you'll find yourself in Urban Cowboy! I love that movie...
Very fun and excited atmosphere. The food was great and service was even better. I enjoyed watching people ride the bull. Even my boyfriend got up there and rode it! I highly recommend this place!

Tasty grub. Come here often when I am on vacation, usually twice. Not a fan of the country & the service is super slow if you redeem a Groupon coupon. It's just the right comfort food. We have enjoyed ordering to go when staying in the Hilton Elara. Ya can refrigerator 
leftovers & warm later.

I didn't feel well after eating here but it might have been some heat related illness. Service was fine but other servers were being hit on and groped to the point that it was distracting and unappetizing. Drink wasn't that great either.

Shoutout to our great waitress Heather!!! She's so great! It's my birthday and she got me a birthday shot that tasted like pineapple upside down cake. I got another one of those! Food was good too, big portions!

Super chill and friendly place to have a great, down to earth dinner in Vega$. I had the Link Sausage with Mashed Potatoes.  The server was named Woody, who was very knowledgeable and friendly, and helped us with our delicious cocktails.   I would definitely recommend this place to friends and colleagues and will definitely come back here.
Unterirdisch schlechter Service. Nach 30min Wartezeit und zwischenzeitlicher Nachfrage immernoch keine Bedienung aufzufinden. Den Laden ohne zu bestellen wieder verlassen. F*** this bar.

I would love to give this place fewer stars, but I can't... because of an amazing bartender named Emanuel. 

We started outside and the outdoor bar, but it started to rain, so we went inside. At the indoor bar, we were ignored for a good 30 minutes. All the while, we were attempting to capture the bartender's attention like we were drowning and she had the life preserver. Nothing. She was literally 2 feet from us and would turn her back to us to serve brand new walk-ups. 

After 30 minutes of neglect, we went back to the outdoor bar, despite the rain. I have a feeling it was because we had all-you-can-drink wristbands, but it doesn't matter. As we were walking out, the manager said, "Thank you, ladies!" (Thinking we were leaving.) I stopped and said, "We're not leaving. We just can't get served in there, so we're going outside." 

Here's what had me most taken aback - she ROLLED her eyes at me and walked away! No, "I apologize. What can I get for you?..." or anything of the sort. Must be nice to be in a position where you can afford to be blatantly rude to customers!

The experience outside was completely different. The bartenders were far busier outside, but they were conscious, attentive and friendly. The only reason I'm giving a decent rating to this place is because of our experience outside, especially with Emanuel. 

Bottom line is we drank 35 drinks between us and tipped more than average per drink, then left an extra larger bill for him at the end. 

I'm not even going to blame the indoor bartender because she's obviously being managed by someone with a horrible attitude and zero clue about customer service.

Thank you, Emanuel, for turning our experience around so quickly and for making my birthday VERY special!!!

Our family came in to Vegas from the U.K., Canada and California during a vacation/birthday celebration. Thursday, April 14, 2017 They ate at their first American restaurant in Las Vegas which was PBR because they had a meal with a show offer. The evening started off well with the fun mechanical bull riding but I'm sad to say that for their first family dinner and a show they received awful service from then on. They were told they could not order their food until 5 pm even though the show started at 7pm. The food came out late, it tasted ok and they ended up having to miss their desserts because they had to leave for the show. My sister in law (who is visiting the U.S) realized she had left her phone at the restaurant and was panicked and relieved to see that it was turned in at the hostess front area. As we got the phone, the waitress came us up at the front and told us we had an extra $6.00 charge after we paid our bill and gave her a proper tip even though the service as not good! Nasty surprise for us seeing as how she wasn't considered about the situation, only that we needed to pay 6.00 dollars. We gave her the cash and left. Needless to say we wouldn't return or suggest anything other than a try at the mechanical bull riding there.  Gave the two stars for the bull and the polite lady who was there running it.

Omg! Don't go here on a weekeend night! The place was packed, so loud we couldnt talk; which might be good for some, poor service! Unfriendly staff!  Sorry but hire more servers! Quite expensive ~ food mediocre.

Make sure you look over your receipt after your bartender runs your card. We asked Kyra to split the bill and she added an extra $10 to each of our bills for herself hoping we wouldn't notice (see photo of our receipts, the math does not add up). 

Also there's a list of $4 shots on the menu but it's actually only $4 if you order with some other drink they have.

My absolute favorite place to eat after Vegas Pool Parties. 
They have outside seating so you don't have to freeze in the air conditioning. 
Good food, beer on draft, nice servers, decent pricing. 
It's in the middle of the strip, which makes it an easy spot to meet with people staying at other hotels. There's also one of those margarita yard cup fill stations right next to it. Good for anyone ready to continue the days partying on way out :)

We came for lunch while waiting for check in. We are trying out a vegan diet and our waitress was extremely accommodating. We got the Fajitas and the Black Bean Burger and she made sure they removed all hidden butter/cheese/etc. The meals were good: nothing too fancy - delicious pub food. It's expensive, but it's Vegas so that's not surprising. 

We came a second time around 1 am on a weeknight and were surprised to see that they still served food. Get the fries!

Ate here several times during our stay. We purchased the food card which saved us tons of money and was one of go to places for lunch and breakfast. Food was great, portions were large and atmosphere wonderful. All around fantastic place.
Our server, Jonathan, was awesome! Very quick and efficient! Also reminded me to use my total rewards card to save some $$! He definitely went above and beyond for our group. Will be bake again!

Myself and six of my friends were drinking outside where we received god aweful service from a bartender named Lisa.  She was beyond rude and is the slowest bartender I have ever had to deal with in Vegas.  We came here to have a good time not deal with this bartenders drama.  If your in Vegas yes they have huge frozen drinks but I would skip it there are so many other places that have great service and this is not one of them

Stopped here for breakfast before leaving Vegas to go home. Robin was our server and she was very sweet and attentive. My boyfriend had a bud light while I just ordered a soda. For breakfast my boyfriend ordered the Mexican Omelette and I had the Western Omelette. Add hash browns for $1.99 extra. He ordered them, I passed but added avocado also $1.99 more. After breakfast was ordered a photographer approached our table and asked if we were interested in having our picture taken. After she took two pictures she informed us that she would return in a few minutes with the photos. We were not obligated to purchase them but chose to since it was his 50th birthday, and the pictures turned out really nice. Our breakfast was really good and the omelettes were pretty large so I am really happy that I passed on the hash browns. All in all a pretty good experience. Only complaint... $4.00 for a soda is a little pricey :(

This place was great and different.  The service was great no lines or waiting time...our waitress was funny and nice.  Me, my fiancee, sister in law, and friend ate here.  This place is a little bit on the expensive side but it's well worth.  I had a bacon cheeseburger with fries and I love it...the appetizers we had was deviled eggs and some type of fries that had onions...buffalo sauce...and cheese which was really good...the only con about this place is that the drink I had was not strong at all...but I would most definitely come here again...

Food was really good and the portions were large. We started with potato skins that were wonderful. They had tons of cheese and bacon. Then I had their chili, which I want the recipe for. The only reason I didn't give it 5 stars is because the wooden picnic table seating was hard on my rump.

Came in here on a thursday night, late.  Inside was so loud we could not hear each other even when shouting. Went to the outside part and it was great.  Loved the outside party/strip atmosphere and our server was GREAT and I give him extra credit for it being 1 am! He told us about he 2 for 1 drinks we could get inside and carry outside.  That brings down his check average but he told us anyway.  That's pretty amazing.  I got the broccoli cheese soup because I didn't want something fried that late at night. It was good.  People in my party got wings and buffalo fries and they were really good. The fries especially. I loved the menu and wished it had been earlier so I could have ordered more. I would definitely go again.
The service was slow and the food had definitely been sitting out for 15 minutes before it got to our table. I had the brisket sandwhich...I've had ice cubes with more flavor.

Has a good location. If you're looking to people watch, this is it.

Food - I bought the bbq burger. Great choice! Had pulled pork and onion rings on it. Very filling!

Drinks - Super pricy here. Beers are $8 to $11 [ unless you get pbr]. Hard alcohol drinks are $10 a piece as well. 

Downside is that you can get these drinks named "the yard". They're super expensive for "3ft" of "booze". It's a giant slushy and it's missing the alcohol. They're loaded with sugar so expect gut rot about halfway through it.

Three orders of chicken fingers and 3 of the worst orders of chicken fingers my family has had in their lives.  Tasted like corn meal fish.  Disgusting.  Will never come back and with a manager who argues about the quality.   I will tell everyone never to eat here

We had a great time here on our last trip to Vegas. A nice place to stop for a drink and catch up with friends while you watch people make a fool out of themselves trying to ride the bull. I can never resist the controlled danger of a mechanical bull. I always end up with bruises or a jammed thumb among other jammed appendages, haha! Glad they had a wide range of beers on tap but I had to have a large PBR to reminisce on how much my Pops used to drink back in the day. PBR me ASAP!

PBR is right on the strip not far from Hard Rock!  It's pretty spacious and serve Las Vegas style Mexican and even my Chicken Quesadilla was not bad. Of course, not authentic by any means, but in the Las Vegas Strip standards, this will do. They do offer a BOGO (Buy One Get One) with your first order of any drinks but here's the catch.... you have to flag the nice lady wearing the shorts with the booties to give you one of those special cards!!  Hahaha....   Overall, great experience and the staff are super friendly!

Until then, be kind to one another and Cheers! ~ :p

If you like top 90's country music with the decor to boot then this is a great place to eat! Live events, bar, bull rides, outside dining, foot long hot dogs, and custom cocktails in cups the size of punch bowls (no not joking and its $65) had a nice service experience; friendly and considerate staff. I recommend the Taco Salad as an appetizer. Personally ordered the PBR Burger and was not disappointed. 2 mojitos, 2 burgers, and a taco salad for a total of $40, not bad for right on the Vegas strip. If you're craving BBQ style food in Sin City then this is a place worth trying. Yeeha!

Beer was ok. Meat was boiled and flavorless--  even the BBQ sauce was bad. They were grabbing plates half finished (to turn the table?) but wouldn't bring the bill. Atmosphere was ok, but we weren't under the fog machine.

Stopped in to get a drink and snack. We sat at the bar. The atmosphere was ok although we were there on a not so busy night. They have a mechanical bull which looked like fun. The food not so good. We ordered nachos. The were actually potato chips with cold cheese sauce from a can with watery sour cream and watery guacamole. They were so bad the bartender took them off our bill. She didn't seem surprised! I give the extra star because of her service! There are much better places to go in Vegas!

You're in Las Vegas, so there are a million other food and drink options to choose from. Only if you're hardcore into PBR, country music, and Bud Light would I recommend coming here.

The mini corndogs we ordered were pretty awesome and started our meal off very well. The shrimp po-boy I ordered made my change my opinion about this place right away.. Enough shrimp, certainly, but the sandwich was hard to eat and there was almost no sauce, so the sandwich was really bready and dry.

I expect bathroom attendants in really nice clubs and restaurants, but PBR Rock bar? What are they thinking? Pet peeve of mine. Probably why this review is 2 stars and not 3.
Great place to drink and have fun. Especially with such a great bartender like chuck! The food was great the drinks were even better. Thanks Chuck for making it such a geat night.

ACK. Don't do it people! We came here in an attempt to have a quick bite without having to venture off the property of PH. Gawd I really regret that decision. I should have known this place was going to be bad news when I walked in and saw a mechanical bull with a line of really LARGE women wearing skimpy clothing, making multiple attempts to catapult themselves onto the bull. FKN BARF! 

On to the restaurant, we were seated promptly but after that it all went downhill. Waitress took our drink order of WATER and came back with 6 glasses 15 mins later! Another 10 mins go by and she finally comes to take our food order. 30 mins later, dreadlocked guy comes to our table and says that he will be our new server. Another 30 mins later still no food. We ask server where the hell our food is at and he says "Well for a party of your size it takes longer." WTF! We had SIX people. Give me a break. Food finally comes out after we waited an hour and we inhaled in 10 minutes because we had absolutely no time to waste. Please keep in mind that the restaurant was not busy AT ALL from the time we started eating til the time we finished. Freaking unbelievable. I will never make the same mistake again. Also, BEWARE of bros and bro hoes! They are running amuck in here!

First of all anyone who gives this place anything under four stars is just ridiculous!  My husband and I ate there two times, and every single thing we ate was awesome!  

We were taken there by my stepson and his friend who had eaten there before and honestly if we go back we WILL go again and will take whoever we are with!  We had dinner one night, and before we left Vegas we went back for breakfast.

So let me tell you about my two favorites there.  First off I think they are called Bucking Bronco Fries or something like that.  French fries, smothered in nacho cheese sauce, topped with bacon, onions, and of course a drizzle of buffalo wing sauce..OMG!!! I am going to attempt to make these, but I can't imagine I can make them like this!  Very large portions on everything!  Second I am a big omelet person, and so the first time we went for breakfast I didn't see one so we went elsewhere.  Finally I went, my husband wanted the fries again, and so I tried the breakfast burrito..AMAZING!  First off it is huge and PACKED with the fillings, I could not finish this.  The green sauce they put on top is simply the best and I would love to buy a freakin jar full of it!!!  

I say when you see Yelp reviews and most are high and only a few are low, GO FOR IT!  Give it a try and make your own review.  For me this is one of those places I am glad I tried, it was truly one of my favorites of all my Vegas food stops : )

The food was great this time. Everybody loved what they ordered. Unfortunately, the service was absolutely terrible and everyone was irritated!

The waiter took quite a while to come over to our table to take our orders and ask if we wanted any drinks. Once we placed our orders, we never saw him again for about 15-20 minutes. He brought the food out and walked away quickly. None of us had any utensils and we all wanted refills on our water/drink orders. 

We had to hunt down someone else to go get us some utensils and asked if the waiter could come back to refill the drinks. It took him FOR-EV-ERRRR. 

We never saw him again after that for a good 20 minutes or so. Once he came back to clear the table we asked for the check and he said he would bring it right over. Nope. Another 15-20 minutes pass and my boyfriend had gotten so fed up with waiting he went over to the hostess stand to tell them how long we had been waiting and that we wanted the check so we could pay and leave. Someone went to get the waiter and he finally brought over the check. 

I like this place because the food is good, prices are good, the atmosphere is fun, and it's a good location, but when service is this bad it really makes us unlikely to go back again.
I came in for lunch.It was better than some of the run of the mill strip restaurants. The service was good, the food was decent.I would come here again over some of the other joints on the strip.

Stopped by to get the infamous Guitar filled with Daiquiri ! I didn't want am AMF which is the standard for the guitars at most other places (AMF makes me black out -_-)

I got a strawberry Daiquiri, the guitar is about $40 and an extra three shots for $6. This put it over the top, the 3 shots were poured into the bottom and the daiquiri on top, the first few sips were nasty, but the rest was pretty weak, maybe shake it up first !

Food was ok..service was slow but they were busy due to NASCAR in town.  Had the bloomin onion dog...OMG when it came out it was huge.  A beer battered deep fried hot dog topped with crispy bacon and ranch WOW!  All in all an average meal.

Based on service and Food this place is an absolute zero. Terrible terrible terrible. Sure the prices are cheap, thats because you would be better off going to mcdonalds as far as food and service are concerned. 

This place does have a great location on the strip with a nice patio right on the strip and cool atmostphere inside. but do not I repeat do not go here for food or expect to get service at a table.

ordered the blue cheese burger, worst burger i have ever had. it tasted like the meat was in a freezer for 2+ years before it was cooked. the fries were so-so and the nachos were big not good. 

Very dissapointed.

AhhhHhHHhHHHHhyyaaayyyyaaiiiii.

I don't know how to review this place. I came here over the weekend, on Friday, and we came at like.... 12:30pm- maybe closer to 1pm.

We (really meaning I) were super hungover and ready to grub on some excellent food. Going against my better judgment, and my trusty yelp, we decided to go here instead of LaSalsas, mostly because we didn't wanna walk anymore.

We sat down outside; it was pretty cool actually. They have benches for larger groups and you are allowed to smoke on the patio. There is a huge bar in the middle of the patio with plenty of chairs around it. There were a bunch of TVs outside as well as inside, so I could see how this place would be a fun bar/restaurant  to go to when there is a big game or fight on.
 
The last time I came here, however, the service was shitty. They sat us down and we waited, and waited, and waited... and waited some more, and no one ever came to check on us. We finally went up to the front and had to beg the hostess to get us a waiter. She said she would work on it, but a waiter never came! So we left.

So, this is why I say, against my better judgment I went here again on Friday.
The service was BETTER, but not great. However, I will give our waitress the benefit of the doubt, and a cut her a little slack, because we did notice she was the only waitress working the patio that day.

That being said, the food... was... OK. It wasn't good. It wasn't bad. It was just OK. I got the breakfast burrito. It's drenched in a green-tasteless-trying-to-be-something-its-not sauce. It almost looked like enchilada sauce but it just wasn't. They have the option of adding meat, so maybe I should've done that, but I didn't and I was stuck with a pretty boring burrito.

I think that if I came back to this place, it'd be at night time, or for a game. But otherwise, I just can't do it captain.

Great location! Outdoor seating is the best, right next to Miracle Mile Shops entrance. Great idea for live music but unfortunately this particular band was too much like karaoke and the lead singer was not that great.  He solicited song from the crowd and a few customers screamed out "Prince" and he said Prince was above his pay level.... then proceed to play Sweet Child of Mine but Guns n' Roses... yet a karaoke classic but did it no justice. The food was disgusting and the service was horrible. This is definitely a place to sit out, drink and sing karaoke favorites with a mediocre band. Maybe if I drank the music would have sounded better and the food would have tasted better and the service wouldn't have mattered.

Was really excited for my birthday to do some karaoke on a Wednesday with five other friends. There wasn't hardly anyone in there and we waited 15 mins at a table and were never acknowledged.  We left.

I should've remembered & known better. My husband & I stopped here late night 10/30. We were starving and it was like 1:30 am and all the other stuff (panda, twin peaks, etc) right there was closed. We were seated and served right away. We had the mini corn dogs & spinach dip. I had a salad, and he had the Mac n cheese. It hit the spot, but by 5-6am my stomach was blown up- most uncomfortable gas & digestion and we had to get up and go to catch our flight home. I forgot that in 2013 my girlfriends and I went there for an early dinner of apps & drinks during a girls weekend. We went about 5-6pm and literally right after eating, I was so uncomfortable after eating there, I had to go lie down for about 3 hours. We were to eat, go back get ready & go out. I don't know what they are using to cook or put in the food, but it does not agree with my stomach! I will never go back there. I'll stick with pizza, hot dogs etc than ever go back there again!

What a fantastic experience! Great food and the service was actually what I can only say was over the top! Sean was incredibly attentive and even laughed at my bad jokes when he was busy! Meant a lot on our first day in Vegas in over 10 years. Andie was serving and she was a doll as well. Highly recommend and ask for Sean :)

2 for 1 drink specials, a great 3 piece live band and a pretty relaxing atmosphere. It was a little piece of heaven on the overwhelming strip for us. Will be coming back the next time we are on vacation here!

This place is all about location views and the environment of being on the Las Vegas strip. The food is decent but not incredible. My waitress was extremely slow and would rush us when asked questions about the menu. Once we received our food we never saw her again and had to go looking for her to get out check. I got the club sandwich and it was very poorly put together. There was hardly any of the mayo sauce and it was just in the middle of the bread and the rest of the. Read was dry. They chose large presentation over making a quality sandwich. It was below average. The views are awesome as the location is right in the center of the Las Vegas strip. If your not gonna sit outside and enjoy the views then there is no point in eating here in my opinion. There are plenty of other places that are too close with better food and service.

Odd experience at this place. In summary the food is average, and by average I mean... Not bad, some good things but nothing special. Except for the PBR Bloody Mary... That was really good. Good service inside the restaurant... 

But the hostesses, oh my god, a total disaster, that is the young ladies that greet you at the entrances lacked intelligence, were rude, slow, unaware, condescending, argumentative, inefficient, unprofessional and hostile.

I came to the restaurant at 7:30 on July 9th. I was given one price for entry by the outside hostess but at the main entrance I was greeted with outright hostility and condescension by another two hostesses and was told the price was higher and was accused of lying.

Another hostess accused me of inappropriately touching her when my shirt cuff accidentally brushed against her. Finally once inside another hostess wanted to make sure we knew the people we were sitting with and stopped to make sure we weren't lying about knowing our table mates.

I am happy to provide a more detailed account to any member of the management team should they want to contact me. 

In conclusion, a decent spot to watch a fight with food and drinks that are not disappointing. But the staff that manages the entrances should not be working in the service industry and are hurting this business with their lack of aptitude, intelligence and basic host skills.

I had an great experience here! Definitely will be coming back. The food was great and drinks were even better. Heather, our waitress, is definitely the reason I will be coming back! Highly recommend her.

Awful!!! Any microwaved dinner is more appetizing than this place. I ordered pasta that was only boiled with little to no cream sauce, besides the water it was dripping. And the chicken was covered in seasoning full of salt that no one could possibly finish. It was awful I had to send it back! I never send anything back, but today I did. If I could give then a 0 I would.

Went to Vegas for the weekend with the wife & son. Drove in Friday afternoon. Came to PBR for dinner around 7pm. Came in and was seated immediately. We chose the patio area to enjoy the views. It took awhile to get our orders placed. Once the food came in, the appetizer was brought with the main course. The server didn't bring my son his Mac & Cheese that we ordered for him. He was brought something totally different than what we ordered from the kids menu. So we had to wait an additional 10 minutes until the correct order was brought for my son. We weren't going to eat while he sat there waiting. that would be rude. So we waited until all 3 of us had our plates/bowls in front of us. At least my son's food was comped. At the end of the dinner, I wasn't really bothered. I was not going to let that ruin the start of the weekend getaway with my fam.

Came here on college night we showed our IDs and it was $10for open bar from 10-12 it was great. Music as good. If u aren't ordering food they ask u to stay only at the bar and not sit at their tables. So they do need more room for people looking for to drink only. The also have a mechanical bull which was pretty fun.
Food was great, but the specialty cocktail I got was gross! Others in my group and standard beer and regular cocktails (co. bulldog etc) and they were fine.

The tostada nachos with pulled pork were amazing! Great view of the strip if you eat outside. Also highly recommend both the mango and strawberry daiquiri. Our waitress was extremely friendly and gave great service.

This place was excellent! I had the half rack pork ribs and it was perhaps the best that I have ever had! The portion was HUGE. Well worth the $18 for the meal.  It was also fun seeing people get launched off the mechanical bull they had inside. The staff were also friendly and the wait time was decent despite them being very busy. I'd come here again if I ever visit Vegas again.

Fast and friendly service, though food was excessively salty.  Grill is always open, so this is good for late nights if everywhere else on the strip is closed.

Yelp check-in awards B1G1 drink.

Loud music and lots of TVs, fun ambiance.  Located right inside the entrance of Miracle Mile.

I stopped into the PBR Rock Bar on Sunday late afternoon to catch a hockey game and a bite to eat before making the drive back to LA.  I got there around 5 and found a seat at the bar in front of a TV that was playing the local news.  The two bartenders basically ignored me for a good 5-7 minutes.  They both seemed pretty bored and miserable, but at least one of them was hustling, so I respected that at least.  When one finally came over, I asked if they would turn the game on, because I did not want to order anything if they could not.  She said 'sure let me find out'.  A few minutes later the other bartender noticed me, and asked if she could 'help me'.  I said that I was waiting to see if I would be able to get the hockey game on.  She replied with "no we can't do that."  I was up and out of my chair, and it is a good thing the manager showed up then to turn the game on for me, otherwise I was gone and this review would have been much worse.  The manager accommodated me, but also seemed like she did not want to be bothered. 

The food was typical and pretty unmemorable.  I was debating between the buffalo chicken sandwich and the BBQ Cheddar Chicken Sandwich, so I asked the bartenders opinion (as usual), and she recommended the former, so I gave it a shot.  I had finally gotten her to lighten up and be a little friendly by this point by being the nice affable guy I am.  The sandwich consisted of frozen chicken dropped in a deep fryer and coated in buffalo sauce with toppings.  It arrived with the chicken half off of the bun with everything falling off of it.  It was not the most appetizing. I fixed it the best I could and some bites were pretty good with the crumbled bleu cheese nicely complimenting the buffalo sauce.  Mostly though, I was unimpressed.

The mechanical bull looked fun, but I was honestly a little turned off by the initial service and food. 
The patio looked pretty cool though and I would return for drinks and to hang out there if people were staying at Planet Hollywood, but I would not go out of my way to come back.

Had our first meal in the dessert here, and loved it.  we had a wait for seating and then a wait to get our first round of drinks, but after that it was all smooth.  My group tried everything from burgers to salads and some appetizers.  All the food was excellent and the drinks were well priced.  I would return to this bar on my next trip to Las Vegas.  PS.. there is a mechanical bull... which ultimately means there will be people on it that shouldn't be.

We were in town and simply wanted to order Wings-to-go so we could get sloppy not in a public forum also FOOTBALL and we didn't want to be excessively rowdy in the bar.

We approached the waitress at the main restaurant and said we wished to get an order of wings to go. She said we could do that through the nearby Daiquiri Bar. What kind of restaurant doesn't allow the hostesses to place orders to go?! Ridiculous.

We sauntered down to the bar (a mere 5 feet away) and placed our order. When the server (Alisha H.) handed me my receipt, I asked about my change and she said that they don't give change and she assumed the dollar I'd mistakenly overpaid was a tip.

I'm not sure what kind of policies the PBR Rock Bar has implemented when the staff is stealing your money to get tips-- This is the direct reason for the one-star rating.

I've also e-mailed their GM and I've received no response yet in 24 hours. Honestly, with the treatment we received, I'm not expecting a response.

Wings were ok. Overpriced but ok.

Will definitely be going elsewhere when we return to Vegas.

Would never return.

Not vegetarian friendly and the food was disgusting. Fianc sent his back to the kitchen and we never got a replacement. Slow service, disgusting food, bad environment, high cost.

We visited here on our last night and they were one of the few restaurant and bar that was opened till 2 am on a Sunday night on that end if the strip and in the PH mall/casino. The waitress was sweet, she communicated well and let us know when last call for drinks and food was- that was greatly appreciated since we were starving at 1 am. Beer and food selections were great and prices average to strip restaurant bar prices.  The atmosphere was fun still and ambiance was exciting even in a Sunday. Great decor and clean! I'll be back to hangout and eat here! I gave it four stars because we didn't get to hang out longer and heard great things about it - I'll update when we revisit.

In Vegas food/ alcohol is more expensive compared to other cities. This is a decent place.  PBR has a plethora of seating options as one can sit near the bar or out on the patio in comfy couches. They do take reservations as customers were still getting tables reserved past 11pm. PBR also has live music, which can be loud and makes it difficult to have a conversation,but that's  a duh with any venue that has live bands. The service was slow that evening as it was difficult to get refills or order additional food/ alcohol. For my entree, I ordered the Baked Ziti which comes with bread. The portion size was decent, and the pasta was so-so. I also enjoyed an Angry Orchard Rose which is definitely a sweet drink.

One nice attribute is that several of the alcoholic beverages comes with a souvenir glass, just be sure to ask for a box. So overall a decent place, with a great location and is open in the early morning hours.

Great, inexpensive breakfast that ranges from $5 to $10.  Bloody Mary was tasty and full of veggies and vodka.  Customer service could be improved because it took 15 minutes for a waiter to serve me.   Once I received my food she was very attentive.  Seating outside is comfortable because misters provide a cooling off experience.

Hostesses were nice, food was mehhh, the guy who served us our food was nice, but the service by our waitress Heather was absolutely atrocious, ambience was pretty lacking too (we were sat next to the escalator). 

I had the brisket sandwich which was quite terrible but would've gotten 3 stars if it weren't for Heather who tipped herself 20% even though her service was a 15% at best. The bottom of the receipt already has the calculated tips and she wrote in pen a total that gave her the 20% suggestion and circled the "total" which also incidentally nearly blacked out the actual printed total pre-tip. We gave her our two cards and told her $69 on one and $23 on the other. Not only was she incompetent and switched the cards (they're not even the same colors) but she charged extra to the one that was supposed to be $23 so that she bumped herself up from a 17% back to 20%. 

It wasn't that much of a difference at all, but it's the principle. Especially because she had me reiterate how much each card was supposed to charged. Besides the fact that she forced us to give her a 20%, she was rude to us from the start when taking our orders practically spewing venom. She was clearly having a bad day but geez if you're going to give yourself 20% you can at least be fake nice / pleasant or at a bare minimum indifferent.

I'll be totally honest, the only reason we came to PBR for a late dinner on our first night in Vegas was for the giant cocktails.  Everything else was just for convenience (if you call walking nearly a mile from the Venetian to Planet Hollywood convenient).

Overall, things were meh at best - it wasn't all that busy but it took a good 15 minutes after we were seated before we even got water, let alone any actual service.   Once we had decided, and someone finally came over to take our order, we ended up with a table full of drink and food.   My boyfriend and I split the 100oz Caribbean Sunset, which we paired with the Bucking Bull Fries, the smoking hot chicken bites, and the Chicken and Waffles.   Overall, everything was good, but nothing really stood out and made our meal memorable.  Not even the large cocktail - and to be honest it was mostly ice and fruit juice.

We had a decent experiance but likely won't be back if next time we are in Vegas.

je n'ai qu'un mot :EXCELLENT!!!!
10/10 pour l'accueil
10/10 pour l'ambiance 
10/10 pour le repas
The food here is very tasty, and the customer service is superb! We had the potato skins, and hot wings! They have a great selection of beers, and mixed drinks.

I'd give this place no stars if I could..   Went for breakfast (they advertise serving breakfast ALL DAY - for real - look at their ad).   My server sauntered over to me to get my order while cradling her glass of orange juice and sipping as she noted my order.  NICE.  Then I proceeded to wait and wait and wait.  I had ordered the steak and eggs.   At least two other parties were seated and ate after me.  25 minutes later - I flagged another server (since mine hadn't checked on me) and asked him to give me the check.  I had enough.  My actual server came and I told her again to get me the check.    10 minutes later the manager came with my plate.    At that point - with my pride and principles - I couldn't touch the food if they paid ME.    The manager apologized and explained that her cook did this to her yesterday too.   Nice to hear I waved and walked out across the way to grab something from Earl of Sandwich.   Had my order in 7 minutes.

Great food.  Location perfect for ppl watching. ..everything was great including the service. 
Many options to choose from and the food tastes great.

This place looked pretty legit so I gave it a chance. It wasn't anything amazing but the nachos we had were pretty good. I was surprised with a barbeque like chip that was used but it still tasted pretty great.

The waitress was cool, but I wasn't about to take crap from anyone for having a glass of reisling. It's a good thing she was nice and very helpful, otherwise she would've dealt with my wrath.

The price of the food was WAY overpriced for what we were getting. I could've easily gone to a Red Robin and got the same stuff for like 10 bucks cheaper. If you had any other option that was cheaper, I'd go with another option. The alcohol was expensive as well.

All in all, this place seems average with what other restaurants have. It's not a place you have to stop by and eat at unless you're a sport nut.

Horrible, horrible service!!! Came here on  a Sunday afternoon on my birthday weekend and sat outside which was not overflowing with people in our section.  We were in a party of about 8 so gratuity was already going to be included. Well, they must of took the fact that they were already getting a good tip to give us horrible service. First of, our waiter took forever to get to us. We ordered food and drinks our waters and regular drinks took about 13 minutes to come out the beers took about 20 mins to come out. Our food  took about 45 minutes.  Our group had two orders of wings once they came out with food the wings were dead cold.  We had no water refills for the longest time. We told our waiter about the wings and he took them back. Then another server lady came by and asked us how everything was we told her we didn't have any silverware nor napkins she came by brought us the silverware she also told us she spoke to the manager and the wings would be comped.  

Well, I had to ask for water with the girl since we had not seen our original waiter since our food came out. We received our bill and the wings were still included on the bill. When we asked our second waiteress she said "she thought they were gonna be comped but they are not". Well, we are not paying and we didn't wr told her and she said she would talk to the manager. She came back and told us they were taken off the bill and they were. 

So was two good burgers entrees worth $50 dollars, Nope!

LOVED this place! We stopped in on a recent trip to Vegas as we wanted to watch a game. There were plenty of TVs, great atmosphere, great service! We'd g back in a heartbeat! Great low-key place with a great vibe!
fun joint, right on the strip you can people watch, get hammered, DJ booth coming soon right on the patio "I heard" this is a deff go to place during the summer!

You literally cannot find a better bar than this one in Miracle Mile.  I spent the last three days there (not counting today, because reality made me leave... darn!) and met some really amazing people (both people that work there and patrons).

It's a huge place, and yes... they have a mechanical bull you can ride (no, I don't ride the bull).

Basically it's three bars and a patio.  For me, the smaller back bar was comfortable.  I tried the big front bar and, while it was still fun, I just kinda felt more comfortable back in the back.  Even when it was busy, it was home.

I won't name names (mainly because I don't think I can find all my card receipts), but everybody that worked in the back while I was there... thank you for making my latest Vegas trip something to remember.

Cheers, and Jameson on the rocks for everyone!  :)

*** Update:

I forgot.  The metal bar stools in the back bar... they seriously suck.  Please switch them out with something with some cushion?  Thanks!

The two highlights of PBR are the mechanical bull and the large format drinks (serves 6+ unless you're feeling ambitious). The food is standard bar/pub food and is nothing to write home about. We tried the bull shrimp appetizer (shrimp with fried tomatoes), wings (buffalo style were actually pretty good, baked in flavor) and the salmon (overcooked). While I didn't try the large format drinks, the group said they were too sweet and tasted like Capri sun, which is to be expected.

Good service with our las rags.com tickets for dinner and a show. Food was ok as were the &12 drinks. The blackened chicken fettuccine was the best of the 3 entries ordered. Bull riding a option if your game!

Food selection is great.... OMG they have a smores martini and dessert?! Breakfast all day? Chicken and waffle bucket?? Holy crap... WTF do i order?!?! That's what was going through my mind on Saturday when I went. 

I'll keep it simple:
-Food is awesome. I was so happy with my order and I wanted to order like 6 other things too. such a good selection and really yummmmmmmm.......

-SERVICE IS CRAP. Our waitress didn't even smile. when she went on break she told us someone would check in on us but they didn't. Her ass didn't even refill our drinks or anything. She came by when the bus boys cleared all of our plates (The bus boys were really nice and did ask us if we needed anything which is like so ass backwards.. +100 stars for them) then asked us if we wanted the bill. I wish I took her name down. We left a $10 tip but really shouldn't have left one at all. I hope she didn't get all of it. 

So there you go. Honorable mentions: lots of TVs, good choice of beers on tap, mechanical bull in the corner.

After landing in Vegas from NY and checking in at Planet Hollywood my first stop was here at Rock Bar. It was late on a Wednesday night, my bartender/waitress was badass! She made my arrival here definitely welcome and was quite genuine. The service was beyond excellent. The drinks were on point and the drink specials were a steal for Vegas. The food hit the spot! Try the wings! Rock Bar will definitely be a Vegas tradition for me from now on. Can't wait to come back!

Excellent place for drink and food 
Good for group and family 
Excellent drinks 
Bloody Mary delicious

11pm, we were starving and hit this place up. There was about 15 of us. It took them forever to get our food out (over an hour), and the bacon cheeseburger was an oversized hockey puck. It was very dry, and I swear the bacon was going to a chip a tooth. However, as hungry as I was I ate this big burger and washed it down with a bucket of beer! Wouldnt go back unless it was the only option.

This place was pretty happening. They have plenty of Tv's and loud music. We sat at the bar and had a variety of drinks. The bartender was cool. The breakfast potato wedges were awesome we ordered 2 rounds.

I ate at this place with family when I was in Las Vegas! I had a great time!! The music was great just know it will be on the louder side! I watched people/kids try to ride the bull and that was really funny!! Plenty of TVS to watch while waiting for the food! The food was great!! 

The only problem I had was not understanding what the waitress was saying. She talked a little fast..

Over all this place was my favorite restaurant in all the places I ate in Las Vegas!!

My friends were invited to do bull riding here during a Vegas trip years ago.. I said I would come back and hopefully try their food.. 4 years later I came back for beer pong.

For a whole pitcher of PBR, cups, and 2 pong balls costs $23; kinda pricey but it's okay! We had a fun time playing beer pong that afternoon. Also other people playing beer pong near us were fun and also helped us whenever we dropped the pong ball. After 2 games, we were just so done and tired. So much alcohol was consumed that afternoon.

Overall, this is a cool spot for fun activities... bull riding, beer pong, food! I still need to try the food though.

I'm torn between a 3 and 4, but I'll go with 3 because the food is average. 

I've been here a few times and the food and drinks have been fine. I would say come here to watch sports, have some drinks, and eat some bar food. 

When I've come here, I've ordered really strange combinations - mainly because I've felt like death from lack of sleep, loss of money, and nights of free booze. 

That being said, the best thing I've ordered there is the chicken noodle soup. Strange, I know, but it's really tasty and comes with grilled cornbread. The coffee is also good. 

I ordered the taco pizza this trip - soggy and lacked flavor. Don't get it. I also got a pb&j during a weird breakfast. The Texas toast isn't toasted and is giant so it doesn't allow for the gooey deliciousness that is a pb&j, plus they use raspberry jelly. It should be grape at any respectable establishment. Slightly kidding. 

The wings are pretty good. You can get some of those and not be disappointed. Oh, and the Bloody Mary is also enjoyable. 

Shots here are huge if you're looking for drinks. Just huge. Dangerously so. Shooters appear tiny next to a shot, but they're the right size. 

The staff is friendly and attentive. It's a fun environment. They've got beer pong and bull riding. You'll need to eat when you're partying and this place is just as good as any other bar you could stumble into.

I was craving BBQ while on the strip. Looked at the menu before committing to a table. The pulled pork sandwich with cole slaw looked amazing. Done. 

Unfortunately, the service took extremely long. By the time I got lemons for my water I was already on my second glass. The food took a while, and when it came out it didn't look anything like the picture. Asked for extra slaw (yum!) because what was served on the burger was sparse (boo!). By the time it came out we had finished eating. 

Decent ribs but the service took so long, not worth the wait! Great location on the strip but you can do better with food quality and service.

Went there on a Tuesday around 6pm for dinner. Not busy so we were able to get seated quickly. The decor was nice. Slick one piece leather seats. If you need to be able to watch TV while eating this is the place for you. They have a gazillion televisions everywhere.

We had the Smoked Chicken Gumbo and the Bloomin' Onion Burger. The gumbo was definitely very tasty. The burger deep-fried inside the breaded onion ring was pretty good too.

Overall not a bad place to eat a meal. Don't know how it is when it's real busy though.

When we went as a group, we were quickly seated even though it was pretty packed. Our food came quick and was warm and delicious! Deep fried pickles, jalepeno poppers, sandwiches, it was all good and at a great price. If we had more time, I would have loved to ride the bull!

So it's 9pm, we have just come out of a show, and we have not eaten lunch that day. I was HANGRY! I'd had my first full day in Vegas and was craving a spot to eat that wasn't inside under a fake sky. We wandered down the strip, my feet getting sorer and sorer in heels, and we spotted the PBR Rock Bar & Grill. I thought there's a patio, I can hear some good music and there are empty tables, DONE! We sat and waited, waited, waited... no service. So my mother pops up and goes to the bar, thinking she'd order us a couple of drinks and some water (we were real thirsty, 24 hours of air travel the day before will do that). They told her that she had to sit down and wait for a server. We could actually see people going up to the bar and being served, but apparently we were in a service area. So we kept waiting. Still nothing. At this point I was close to hysteria. I'd had about 10 hours sleep in the last three days and I was hungry and thirsty, these things are not a good combination. She went up again and was told "Ma'am please do not come to the bar again, someone will come to serve you." We were almost ready to walk about when a young guy came buy, bringing out someone else's food. We dragged him over and begged him to take our order. He said that he couldn't but thankfully he sent someone right over. FINALLY. Normally I'm pretty relaxed about this kind of thing, people are busy, they're doing the best they can, bar girl was just following the rules blah blah blah, but it should not be that hard to get a glass of water?

We couldn't decide on entrees so ordered a bunch of sides, the corn was awful, but the macaroni and cheese with doritos was super delicious, mashed potato wasn't hot enough, coleslaw was just coleslaw from a packet. Beers were big and well priced. All in all it's not like I wouldn't come in here for a beer and some french fries if I was back in Vegas and was walking  by but it does not bring good feelings to mind when I reflect on this particular encounter...

Interesting place. Very busy. Had the smoked brisket dip. Was more like pot roast. A little disappointed, but it's ok. It is Vegas and I'll walk it off and search for the next good meal if one exists in Vegas.

Possibly the worst customer service orientation I have seen in Las Vegas. we we invited to join a table of four and, though there was plenty of capacity in the venue, apparently there was no possible way to accommodate this. Then, after we were seated separately within shouting distance, we were told it was not possible for one table to buy drinks for another table as they were "different sections". It could have been lazy service but, since the rest of the service was pretty good if not great, I suspect it is management. Too many good places in Vegas, skip this one!
Cassie was the absolute best! Come check out this place for a brewski or twoski if you want to hang out for a bit

It's a fun place.  Go here for the bar style food and cocktails.  Try the southern hospitality.  Goes well with brunch.   :)

catfish po boy is solid.
fresh made bbq potato chips are win.
Pretty Cool, Good Music Great Drinks.... And Mechanical Bull, Few Friends Got On, It Was Fun, I Will Be Back, Also On The Other Side Theres A Club With Dance Floor And Dj
definitely a place to stop for a beer on the strip. The outdoor bar is really nice to sit at and relax after a day of walking. service there is pretty good.

Not a bad place, we stopped here for dinner on a nice and cozy night on the strip. The waitresses seated and greeted us at the door. It was a nice relative crowd outside the restaurant, but thats what youd have to expect in vegas. I love the big texas beef burgers with fries, the last time i got the barbecue ribs with potato salad, and it was to die for. The drinks are great, margaritas off the rocks are what i would reccommend.My girlfriend i think ordered fish tacos, i cant really remember, but she was happy and i was happy, cant wait to stop by again. I love the vibe and atmosphere at this location.

Cool atmosphere. A cross between cowboy bar and hip hop. A couple of bars in the dancing area with the dj and karaoke which make getting a beer or drink easier to access. There's also a completely separate bar that is more of a cowboy bar than the other so as to not disappoint the sound of the name. I personally know the dj so I stayed in the dance area but more was going on there anyways. DJ Sally keeps that place hopping. The karaoke is fun for everyone. One guest did a jodeci song and the next did an Elvis song and everyone enjoyed. The stage for karaoke makes it a pro feel to it. Having to get up on an elevated stage with lights in your face gives it a more star feel to singing in front of everyone which is cool. It's a step up. Adequate space throughout. I did not spend much time in the other side except to use the restroom which is on that side. It was even more space and more of the traditional type of cowboy bar that I'm used to seeing in SoCal.

From start to finish, the staff at PBR Rock Bar and Grill were pretty awesome. We were there for the beginning of a bachelor party and got set up with Jessica I believe for our server and she did a wonderful job. The portions were pretty darn big and the club sandwich I got was very good. They let the bachelor ride the bull for free as well as another member of our group who was having a birthday. We hit up the beer pong tables and watched a ton of sports. They were able to accommodate our party of 14 which was great. All in all it was a great place to kick off a crazy night in Vegas!

This place was great. Large portions of food for affordable prices. Great service and ambiance.  I ordered the chicken quesadilla and it was so high I couldn't finish it. It wasn't too crowed when we were there so our server gave is his undivided attention.

Stopped here for a with some friends for lunch. Always stopped and ate at the  Earls Sand-which right across and never gave it a thought to try it out. 

During the day they have plenty of TVs with the sports of the days going on. Food can be a hit or a miss. One thing I would recommend is the Buckling Bull Fries. Bucket full of fries, covered in nacho cheese, buffalo dressing and grilled onions.

One good thing is that they give you a free bull ride for the table so be sure to redeem it. $5 additional per person.

My review is for their nightly bar/club.

Back in October 2012, I visited the outside bar for their Friday happy hour from 3-6pm and I really enjoyed it.

This past weekend I was able to experienced their bar/club area on a Thursday Night and Saturday night. Both nights it was with a group of people. 

We arrived to Vegas on Thursday around 8pm and started walking the strip around 10pm in search of a bar with cheap drinks and some good music. We were approached by a promoter for the bar and go us in for free. Music was great it was a mix of Hip-Hop & Top-40. Drinks were decently priced ($7 for well). 

Saturday Night we didn't want to do the whole club scene at a premier club so we end up contacting the same promoter who end up giving us his info on Thursday night. He got us in for only $25 which included open bar all night. Again the music was pretty much the same as Thursday. 

Overall, it was a great bar/club. If you are simply looking to grab cheap drinks, dance and have fun without all the premier glam, this is the spot. No waiting to get a drink, no bumping into people and ladies no long lines to use the restroom.

The place is off of Las Vegas Blvd at Planet Hollywood. Kind of dark and a bit gritty but it is a PBR bar & grill. Unfortunately they were out of the buns for the brisket sandwich so I had to get the pulled pork. Music is loud but got a free beer for checking in. The portions are big! Everything made in house. 

Update : at 10 pm a DJ took over and had loud music from the bar and different loud music in the restaurant. The bun on my sandwich was soggy and didn't eat it. The best part of the meal was the kettle chips. I don't think I'd eat here again.

We walked by PBR and a hostess told us we could get open bar for 2 hours if we followed them on Twitter. I don't have a twitter account so I quickly made one and joined the bar with two friends. Our bartender was awesome! Made our drinks quick was super friendly and offered to take some pictures of us. 

They have a bull you can ride, no one in my group tried but it was fun to people watch. If you are staying at Planet Hollywood or just want a quick drink walking down the strip I would recommend stopping in here. Especially since it seems like they have some type of drink special every night. We didn't try any food but it sure looked yummy as it came out the kitchen.

The experienced started with Miss Personality of the year award winner restaurant hostess who didn't do much other than shake her head in different directions. The waitress was nice and friendly; however, the service was so incredibly slow. It took 15 minutes to get our order in, food took over 30 minutes to get to us and paying to leave was another process on its own. Food was okay. Not memorable enough like other Vegas meals I had. Maybe it was just the poor experience that made me not remember the meal.

Review is for the frozen bar.

Overpriced, even for Vegas. Not nearly as good as Fat Tuesday or Lime Ice.

My review would be a one-star if this wasn't on the strip.  I get it, it's tough to find cheaper food options on the strip.  (When I mean cheaper, I mean their entrees here are roughly around 11-15$)  But, even given the handicap, it's still pretty poopy.  My group had a bad experience with a server but all the other times I've came, the bartenders have been pleasant.  Decent sized Shock Top for 9 dollars... I'll take it.  (Again- it's the strip, I'm compromising)  Their patio is right on Vegas blvd across from the Cosmo, so that's a redeeming quality.  In general I think Planet Hollywood has some of the weakest restaurants/beers on the Strip.  Miracle Mile is the only reason I go there.  I'd say if you're at Planet Hollywood and you want to drink beers on the patio and eat below-average bar food then give it a go.  Or if you're into the whole obnoxious loud sorta-country bull-riding ambiance.  Other than that there's cheaper food and drinks elsewhere.

Again I find myself in the most undesirable position of running a touch late in my scheduled evening activities, therefore I have become adept at food quickies. 
During a busy 6:00PM Friday evening dinner rush, we were seated promptly and our server was quick to address our table, even though NFL wild card weekend was in full swing. Located in the middle of the strip next to Planet Hollywood this eatery had just what we were in need of, some quality noshing food, served up quickly. 
What an asset to PBR Rock Bar, our server was. 
Joe recommended just what this hungry trio needed with no up-sells, expedient in all facets of serving and with a sense of humor and a smile all servers could learn valuable lessons from.
The Chicken Quesadilla had serious amounts of shredded/pulled chicken, pepper jack cheese and decoratively topped with sour cream and pico de gallo.
