She was also assuming the previous order was the same s the next order which wasn't the case because some of the guys were leaving. long story short, we ended up leaving behind four full beers that we paid for, but didn't order.

The second time I went was great.  I can't complain. And it was very relaxing.  The food is typical bar food, no big deal, but it is such a nice way to chill when you've been walking around all morning.

Went here around 11:30pm Wednesday night, we had a travel zoo drink voucher that we had purchased at a reduced price. We decided to hit the walk up bar rather than going inside (the music was SO loud and the  inside was packed), the girl at the bar totally ignored us even though we stood in front of her for atleast 3 minutes before she looked up. We handed over the coupon, she looked at it dumbfounded, and then said "Ok, you can only get this cup!" as she showed us the Pilsner cups, we knew this already since it clearly stated it on the voucher. So we told her what flavor frozen drink we wanted, I got the Hurricane and my wife got Coral Crush, mine was down right sour, pretty much undrinkable, and the coral crush was way too sweet. Pretty glad we didn't pay full price for the drinks or the horrible service.

Came here for lunch with a larger group. Service was mediocre. What was supposed to be a 1 hour gambling break turned into a 2 hour waiting game between food and the bill. Food was standard bar type food.

This place was not as crappy as it seems! We came here late (after seeing the travesty that is Peepshow) and there was no wait at all. They let women ride the mechanical bull for free and as we were seated close by, we had entertainment the whole time. 

The food was not bad at all as long as you are not expecting a mind-blowing epicurean experience. The buffalo strips are nice and crispy and had a nice kick. The ranch was meh. The pepperoni pizza was actually really tasty.

Just your typical bar food experience, but at least it's cheap by Vegas standards. The service is pretty good as well.

So it's my first night in Vegas and I had a hankering for a burger. The boyfriend and I stopped here on a Thursday night and it really wasn't crowded at all. The first thing I noticed was the inconsistency of the style of the bar with the design, music, posters, etc. For one thing it's trying to play that cozy country bar attitude, but it has faux leather booth seats as if you're sitting at an Applebee's and the music really leaves a lot to be desired. (2000's pop music, totally not the vibe they were going for) The wait staff was nice and friendly but also didn't go out of her way to make sure our drinks were refilled on time and we had to wait.

Now I can totally overlook the feel and music, and uncomfortable seating IF the food is good.
Unfortunately, that wasn't the case here. For the appetizer, we ordered the chili cheese taters. The taters were fresh and hot but totally buried under way too much cheese and even more chili. I usually like chili, but this wasn't a homey comfort food chili, it was more like 90% out of a can chili.

For dinner, I got a BBQ burger which is usually a go-to for me because I love BBQ sauce. The burger was falling apart, and not in a good way. And it definitely wasn't cooked medium, it was well done. Also a big no-no for me is if food doesn't have any flavor. There was really no taste except the toppings and the ground beef. If I took ground beef with no seasoning and cooked it well done at home, it most likely would've tasted better than what I got. So it looks like I won't be coming back here.

If you want a good burger, try Burger Brasserie! That place was surprisingly awesome!! After coming here, I was pretty nervous to try burgers anywhere in Vegas, but wasn't disappointed.

Visited this location while in Vegas on business. We wanted to stop for some late dinner grub.

We ordered the bucking bull frys. They were good not as hot or spicy as I was expecting. The chili cheese taters on the other hand were actually spicier than the bull frys. The chili cheese taters were good with plenty of chili. They are not for those light of heart or counting calories. Those have got to be 2000 calories alone lol. There are enough for at least two adults to share easy. 

The BBQ hamburger was cooked very well. Served with a perfect medium pink through out. It was a good meal even for bar food. My co-workers had various foods they all enjoyed including potato salad, other burgers, and chicken sandwiches.

The location is loud for sure its a country bar so understand that up front. We sat in the restaurant area to eat. There is a bar side with karaoke and open floor area were people danced. 

The server was great full of personality and made good recommendations on the food. 

Overall not a bad place to stop in for a bar food night.

This review is for 3.5 stars.

I don't know what else you can ask for at a bar on the Strip.  Rock climbing wall, beer pong, and a full bar.  It's not gonna blow you away with the quality of the drinks, the selection, or the prices, but overall it's a nice spot if you're looking for somewhere to drink.  They have a solid Happy Hour and they have  an outside area to strip people watch if the weather is right.  It has a similar vibe to any of the other chain bars, but the ideal location on this side of the strip knocks it up a peg.  There are definitely better places to go if you're looking for a quality drink or an upscale clientele.  But if you just want a college environment similar to a Tilted Kilt or the like, then PBR is a great substitute.

Another place we visited during our anniversary getaway in Vegas a few months ago. This was the first place we visited as soon as we landed. I never had wings as good as the one this place provides. All I know is that they were fried, dipped in cheese sauce, and sprinkled with Doritos bits all over. We fell in love with this place.

We came here the first night of our stay at 3 in the morning. Service was great, I wish I remember our server name because he was awesome, really nice guy (it was July 31). We sat outside even though it was hotter outside they have misting machines all around to keep it cool. The food came out pretty quick and it was delicious, we ordered a mix of breakfast and regular food and it was all good. We liked the food so much we came back the next day with a larger group and sat outside again. It was busier and we got a different server this time. The food took a long time to come out, and I got an egg sandwich which must have been cooked first because it was cold and everyone else's was good. I didn't complain about it because I was too hungry, another person also complained the chicken was very bland. Other than that the food was good. The Doritos crusted Mac and cheese was amazing! The tator tots were also delicious.

Four words that I had thought would have had me hooked--- SWEET POTATO TATER TOTS.  Although they were good with their little maple dipping sauce, they were the only redeeming quality of PBR Rock Bar and Grill.  These are the only reason that 2 stars are being given here. 

Other than that, with Vegas offering so much more, I have to say that this place is a waste of your time.  Explore other places that have better service, food and seem less trashy.

Did someone say Happy Hour ? Well if you enjoy a good happy hour this is the place to go for those who want to enjoy a GREAT Happy Hour. 

The food prices are outstanding the drink prices are amazing. The food portions are large and the drinks are tall.

All of this in a large country bar atmosphere. 

Not only do they have a great Happy Hour but the also after the only $35 open bar which is outstanding. 

So, cmon down to the PBR Bar when you're ready for a good time. Located center strip at the Planet Hollywood. 

Btw- They also have mechanical bull rides !!!

Terrible service. Went for dinner and drinks last night. Hostess did not bother to acknowledge us when we walked up and made us feel as though we should be grateful for their ability to seat us. Once seated we waited 30 mins before a waitress even stopped to say shed be back to get our drink order. Needless to say we got up and walked out. Customer service is lacking. I dont care how great of a place it is. There are another 1,000 just as cool places in vegas. Not worth the time.

Absolutely worst food I've ever had and the service was just average. My fianc and I came in for our first meal since we arrived in Vegas and was way more than disappointed. What I ordered did not mention anything about having sour cream on it in the menu but it came out with sour cream drizzled all over it. I'm a server myself and didn't want to be that customer that complains so I decided to wipe the sour cream off. It still sucked! Our waitress came with a refill for my fianc while I was trying to wipe off the sour cream with a napkin and didn't even say anything to me about wanting to remake the dish so I didn't have to continue to wipe it off. Other than that it was also not even warm. Again I'm not the complaining type but however I do want to try and warn other Yelp reviewers that this is a place to avoid.

This is an AWESOME place to catch a sporting event in LV.   They have really cool seating spaces, but get there early!  Country music is commonly thumping throughout and the wait staff is decidedly good natured and fun!  The Chicken Club is AMAZING, huge and full of goodies like avocado!

This place has a cool location. We sat outside at the fire table for breakfast. I only got an egg and toast but my boyfriend liked the BLT and the bloody Mary's were delicious! and the drinks were buy one get one free with yelp check in!
Awesome service, request Aaron he's awesome! Try the Brisket Salad, you won't be disappointed!

I could not give a worse review. We had reservations for over a week and came in on time with our company party of 11. Within minutes of sitting down, our waitress came over with a horrible attitude. Several members of our party checked in on yelp to take advantage of the buy one get one free drinks and we were looking over our menus for food. The waitress' attitude went from horrible to nuclear and she began complaining even louder that it would take her 20 minutes to honor the yelp offer. Waters were not even served during 5 minutes of waiting further and we could see our waitress venting about us. Keep in mind we were there for less than 10 minutes at that point. We went directly to the manager to ask for a new waitress and after having to wait for a customer in front of us also complain for some unknown issue with their party, we decided to get up and leave. All 11 of us got up and walked out without having ordered one thing. Huge loss for PBR!!!! I have never seen such bad service and will never go back to any PBR... ever!

Real fast service. Food did not come out hot but it was delicious so I didn't send back. They will give out a free personalized post card if you opt for a free photo! Must get the Mac n cheese balls!! Overall, decent priced comfort meals.

Great breakfast. Both my wife and I shared a breakfast pizza and it was delicious. The $12 watermelon drink called Hat Bender was also good. My wife ordered that and I tried a little. 

Our server Dieago was a super nice and friendly guy. He's the one that recommend the pizza and drink.

Nothing bad to say and I would return again.

This place sucks! Service sucks. Apparently, if you come with 6 or more people the server has to send the checks separate because the kitchen " gets mad." At least that's what our server told us. (BS) So, our food came out at all different times. We ordered at 1pm, meanwhile, they aren't busy, and finally everyone's food came out at 1:45. We only ate our food because we were starving. Don't even bother coming here, waste of time and money.

This review is based only on their yard margaritas. A group of friends and I came here late last night cause we couldn't find a fat Tuesday's and we were lazy to walk. Hahaha the girl that was serving us was stale and had an attitude. My boyfriend and I got the pia colada with 2 extra bicardi shots. First of all, the pia colada tasted gross. It didn't even taste like pia colada. It felt like I was drinking a glade plug in! That artificial sweet taste with a hint of lighter fluid after taste. I looked at it and wished I walked the extra few feet to go to fat Tuesday's. Plus, they charge 5 bucks for each extra shot, so my $17 margarita was $27!! And I watched her pour the bicardi into the margarita, it wasn't nearly two shots. The girl didn't even know what rum was. My boyfriend asked what rum she had besides bicardi and she just blurted out everything she had behind the counter with attitude. Wth. Fat Tuesday's extra shot is a $1!! Go there and save yourself from this place. The drinks represent the girls that work there, weak and gross.

"I remember that night. You had like four daiquiris." -- Little Nicky (2000)

Have you ever had an entire yard of strawberry daiquiri? Yeah, entirely too sweet. But, also delicious. PBR rock bar, with an outside bar at the bottom/outside of Planet Hollywood hotel, has many sizes to buy of frozen cocktails.  A few things to note, however.

1) The tables are if you are eating only
2) Get a yard, super yard, Bull, Boot, Guitar, whatever and take it to go and walk the strip with it
3) Go inside, just past the hostess stand for more drink options - the bar only has two drink choices - inside there are 6 or 7
4) You can get additional shots added for cheap

The service at the outside bar was painfully slow - we waited an eternity to find out that they did not have the guitar we wanted, but we should go inside. But I went ahead and ordered since they had a purple yard for me. Little did I know they had better flavors inside.  Lesson learned.

So after I got my drink and went inside to find my friend, I realized the additional flavors. The staff was friendly and happy to offer additional shots to the guitar - 5 for $10, we think? Anyway, we declined and off we went with the guitar full of frozen goodness. 88 ounces is a LOT of sugary drink, but it certainly caused a lot of people to stop us along the strip.

The PBR Rockbar was the neutral meeting spot for my party. I checked-in here with Yelp so I got the buy one drink get one free deal, that was cool; but the drink I ordered had pineapple juice in it, and I believe it was bad or the cup wasn't clean I don't know which but I swear the drink tasted like ice cold vomit. When we took the drink back to the bartender all she said was oh no the pineapple juice is good, smh it was soooo disgusting.  Where in the hell was John Taffer when I needed him!?!?! I can't believe I even tried to force myself to drink that sh!t. She took our drinks and threw  them out and said if we wanted new drinks we had to pay again,yeah right. Fxck these drinks. The first drink was just ok, and the second round tasted like vomit, umm pass. Probably would have tasted better if I was already drunk, but vomit flavored is very hard to ignore. There were some guys there playing beer pong, and they had the ball flying all over the damn place. A few times the ball was on the floor in the corner where the "VIP" couch and main window/wall is, if you look on the ground and see the filth build-up smh, I was thinking these MF'ers are gonna have Hepatitis A by the end of the night. Beer or alcohol doesn't kill everything, but good luck guys! What I was really surprised about was the music though. With the name of it being PBR Rockbar I expected to hear mostly Country or Rock, but they had a mix of Hip-Hop playing, old Hip-Hop but still. Anyway this wasn't a great experience for me and I don't feel like this is my type of bar anyway, so more than likely I would personally not come back here to spend money.

Came here in the evening. The bartenders are super nice and friendly and that's where all the stars go. The outside area is nice; but the inside is super dark. The drinks were fine, if a bit forgettable, but I wouldn't really come here just for drinks or a night out--it doesn't seem like somewhere to go to chat over drinks or dance; it's definitely a food place/sports bar. The set up of the place is a bit awkward, with weird columns everwhere. Maybe it was just the night I visited.

This place is cheap ass...they lied to that they don't have titos vodka for my free drink and gave titos to guy standing next to me.
Not worth it

I'd like to give this place two stars based on my first experience with this place but alas you are only as good as your last encounter PBR Rock Bar.  I know you can do better as you have!  The original time I went here was a year ago for my Sister's 21st bday.  We sat in the outside patio area and had a blast!  The waitress was awesome, drink specials were decent and the atmosphere was great.  So when we were in Vegas for 4th of July weekend this year, again celebrating a 21st bday this time for my cousin, we were super excited to go back here.  It was a Sunday and they had all these advertisements for something like $10 all you can drink from 9pm-1am.  As it was almost 9pm we asked one of the hype women standing out front of the outside bar that was yelling about the special.   (I call them hype women as I don't think they were waitresses and they didn't know enough information to be a hostess.) They said yes come back at 9pm and for $10 we could drink until 1am.  PERFECT!  So we came back around 915pm and grabbed a seat at the outdoor bar.  Once we sat down the waitress came up and we inquired about the special.  This is where it went downhill, FAST!  She told us that the special wasn't for the outside bar it was only for inside.  Umm OK?!  So we went inside and asked the snotty hostess there about it.  She said she had no clue what were talking about to which we pointed to the sign right next to her stating the special.  She pointed us down the hall and said to ask down there.  We walked a few feet to another entrance.  Upon entering this rundown, hole-in-the-wall looking area we saw an empty bar to our right and a couple beer pong tables to our left and another bar behind them.  There was an employee moving tables and cleaning floors and then a few couples playing beer pong - no one else.  A waitress finally walked up to us to see if we needed help and we again brought up the promotion, which we found was Twitter driven so you had to become their Twitter fan in order to partake.  Side note here: I have done this type of promotion in Vegas before and they ALWAYS SUCK!  You will get every line in the book about why you aren't applicable - "we ran out," "We served all we can on that promotion," " where did you see that at?" etc, etc - it's only to get you in the door and they figure since you are there you will spend money!  Ok back to the terrible service at PBR - so the waitress gets the GM/Promoter of this special to help us.  This guy walks up to us doesn't introduce himself and is as cold as can be.  He asks what we need and we AGAIN repeat why we are there.  He asks if we all have a Twitter and we say yes and that we understand the promotion.  Then he looks to my cousin who is wearing a tank top and asks if he has another shirt to put on.  Now keep in mind it's July, in Vegas, and 120 degrees outside.  No my cousin says to him and the guys says Oh well then we can't serve you.  We inquire about the three guys playing beer pong ALL in tank tops and he says that they aren't here for that promotion.  WTF?! What do you have to wear a suit now to a rinky dink, drab bar in order to pay $10 to drink all  you want of their watered down well drinks?!  That was the last straw - we left all quite irritated.  If he didn't want to make the $50 he could have off of us and if he wanted to lessen the servers/bartenders tip money that night so be it.  If he is the person running this place I honestly want to have nothing to do with it.  Word of mouth travels fast and I've already recommended a few good places (AHEM Peppermill) to friends on their way to Vegas this Summer and rest assured PBR Rock Bar is NOT one of them.

Rock bar. 
Buffalo wings.great! 
 Chili cheesy dog fries. awesome. 
service is a bit slow. but it's vegas. sit back and watch the game... your server/menu/drinks/food will come, eventually.

Ok. Fun place if your looking for bar. Only problem my food was all wrong. And if you have food allergies and need to follow a special diet I wouldn't go...  Then I was told it would taken off check. But no adjustment made.

Ok so I went to this place on a bar crawl & the atmosphere is killer cool. Got a couple drinks & they were good. Mechanical bull was entertaining as hell & the FINEST woman was there working the bull. That will always be the night I fell in love from the across the room & when she kissed me on the cheek for a pic

Our dinner here was part of a package for the V Theater, so the menu was very limited. The food was goof though. To start we had the choice between a house salad and a soup, for mains we chose the Vegetarian Fajitas and Southwest Steak Salad, and dessert we had the strawberry shortcake and root beer float.
The menu was very outdated and most of the beers they had on there they didn't have anymore, but the food was all still the same. I asked for my salad dressings on the side (most places put too much on) and they forgot on the house salad, lucky they got the balance right. And my steak was cooked perfectly. The desserts were so/so but we ate them all so still descent enough. 
The beers were a bit expensive, but it's Vegas.

Stopped by for their $5 shots a few times.  LOVE the $5 Cherry Bombs.  Didn't get anything to eat, but I would try it for food next time. 

I thought the ladies serving booze were fun.. Even blew a whistle when we took our shots that made it seem more exciting and Vegas-like.

Me and my friends met here. Was not really crowded on a Saturday night. Spent most of my time at the bar. Bartenders were friendly and attentive. Drink was decent. Food was ok. Nothing spectacular about it. Good place to meet up but wouldn't spend my entire night here.

First of all, PBR stands for Professional Bull Riding not Pabst Blue Ribbon. I went in expecting hipsters in skinny jeans and got cowboys in skinny jeans. Huh. But it's a cool place to watch football if you don't mind the country scene. Plenty of TVs. They have drink specials from 3-6 and you can get a Bud Light bottle for $3, which is pretty good for Vegas. There's also a mechanical bull for those into that sort of thing.

They also have a daiquiri stand you can buy from while walking through the mall. They serve daiquiris from 16oz all the way up to 100oz and you can even get an 80oz guitar shaped daiquiri if you feel like being one of those guys. They're not very strong, but if you keep the cup you get a discount when you go back which makes it an ideal way to keep your buzz going while you walk around.

Love this place! Try the chicken and waffles pizza witha side of maple syrup - mind = blown.  Tons of TV's playing any sport you can imagine, and quite entertaining to watch people ride the mechanical bull. Staff is extremely attentive and friendly, and the bartenders at the Rockbar are extremely easy on the eyes. Perfect for lunch and a bloody mary on their patio, or dinner before going out on the town. A+ Anerican food.

I have been here several times now and as I continue to eat various items on the menu it continues to impress me. It is really hard to find great food on the strip, this place has figured out how to do it right! 

I had the Taco Salad 2 nights in a row for dinner and loved it. We had the boneless chicken wings in BBQ sauce during the super bowl and I loved them, actually wish that I was still in Vegas because they sound really good right about now. I can't remember off hand what I have eaten here the prior three times that I'd eaten here, however I know that I was just as impressed. 

They have amazing deserts, I have had the chocolate chip skillet cookie and now the glazed donuts and I must say that both were excellent. 

Buckets of beer, excellent food, TONS of TV's and a great atmosphere ... not sure what more one could ask for.

My husband and another couple came here for lunch and dinner. This place has delicious food! We ordered the 10 piece buffalo wings. The wings were very meaty and had delicious sauce. Our friends were talked into ordering a 24 piece bbq wings. It was a little too much food for them. The bbq sauce was amazing! I loved it on the wings and pizza. The only downsides were than my pizza was burnt and the food made me feel pretty full and gross afterward 

The atmosphere is great to be. They play good music during the day and night. It is was exciting to watch beer pong on the tvs from the other room and the mechanical bull riders. 

The service was great. Staff was attentive and helpful while ordering. Great food and good prices for Vegas!
The atmosphere here is AWESOME, the food is great and it came out SUPER fast. Military discount every day too. LOVE IT!!

Just to give you some perspective, I had to create a yelp account just to write this.

This was my first time in Vegas so I was your typical tourist walking up and down the strip looking for a place to grab a drink. It was 5:00 PM so I was looking for a place to cash in on a happy hour deal and watch some sports. 

Since this was a Wednesday night in November there were little options for sporting events. However, the Penguins were playing the Capitals, which if you know anything about hockey you should know that's worth throwing on one of the 50 tvs they have. Instead they had replays of MAC football games and the NFL network on (remember this is a Wednesday).  So ok, they made a mistake. As the only person at the bar I kindly asked them to turn on the hockey game. The sweet bartender said she will find a manager who has permission to do so(which she did). However the manager (who seemed like a real douche) couldn't complete this simple task. Therefore, I was forced to be that guy who asked them to turn on the game three times. 

On top of this, their fire alarm came on and everyone on their staff just continued on working. I asked the bartender if we should be concerned and evacuate, in which she replied, "no, this happens all the time". 

The game eventually came on and I was already face deep into buy one get one gin & tonics plus happy hour food specials so I stayed. Moral of the story, you can certainly find a better place to get some food and enjoy a drink. They are awarded one star for their kind bartender and cheap deals (compared to other places on the strip).
A great menu!  Friendly service, classic Rock music that I grew up with, too many big screens to count followed by hugely portioned good food....yes it gets my "two thumbs up".

Highly disappointed with my server.  It seems that he forgot about my wife and I on several occasions.  Brought me incorrect beer.  Asked if I wanted an orange for my Blue Moon and I said yes.  It is 3 days later and I still have not received my orange.  This place has been good in the past but my trip this weekend was not.
Horrible food. Bacon was hard as a rock. Potatoes was cold, so was my eggs. I wouldn't recommend this place for breakfast

Walking by the outside seating area after we'd already eaten breakfast elsewhere, we stopped to check out the menu. The outside hostess, CrystaLyn, came over to ask if we had any questions. She spent several minutes with us discussing the menu highlights and answering questions (I still can't wrap my head around chicken & waffles), her pride and enjoyment of working there came through so much we decided to go there for dinner that night. We sat outside, which was about 1/3 full, our wait person, Heather, was right with us for our drink orders and answers. She was personable and friendly. We asked about the morning hostess and she told us they were two of the staff that had been there from day one. You could tell how much Heather enjoyed PBR that this was not just a job for her she loves it. Beyond that our food was outstanding. Hubby had Chicken Caesar, lots of chicken and great dressing. I had BLT w/fried egg. Tons of bacon cooked to perfection, the egg was cooked perfect over hard but not dried out. We also had the deep fried pickles, one of our fav appetizers, and these were the best we've ever had. Next time we're in Vegas this will be our go to place for food, not just for the food but the wonderful service we received. Thanks CrystaLyn and Heather.

The drinks are good. Don't waste your time buying food they messed up my order THREE times. Cold French fries, Brunt hamburgers when I requested medium (pink on the inside). I Asked the first time no bacon and they bring it back the third time with bacon. And then our waiter (Jonathan 6083) had an attitude like it was our fault they couldn't follow basic restaurant orders. Then I had to ask for the manger, like where is the Vegas hospitality?  Like shouldn't you want to come and greet you customers. My friends and I were excited to visit this place because a fb video; we were truly disappointed. Its true what they say new Vegas only wants your money.

I really wanted to like this place. Prior to my recent trip to Vegas, I had come across quite a bit of information regarding PBR. All of the photos and information made it seem like a fun, interesting place.

A few of us needed a quick bite after a long walk perusing the strip. Of the choices around Miracle Mile, I opted for PBR based on the above. We entered where a sign said "entrance", but had to ask a server if we were to seat ourselves only to be shown the hostess stand opposite of the "entrance" sign. Not a big deal, but a little confusing (saw others do the same as we did). 

We were seated outside, and opted to order appetizers as we wanted to get back to our adventures on the strip. I ordered a drink that claimed to have a favorite rum of mine in it, and a side of fries. The drink was good enough, but I'm not sure it contained any alcohol as I certainly could not taste even a hint of the rum. The fries were edible, but I wouldn't care to pay for them again - reminiscent of Burger King fries and were lukewarm at best. Another I was with ordered the Bucking Bull Fries, and was equally displeased, as was the one who ordered the Signature Wings.

The server was pleasant, but she disappeared for a long time halfway through our quick stop (went on break?) -- halfway really being about the time we were ready to leave. Our quick stop turned into being there for almost an hour. A couple of us even left as we waited for the server to return to take payment. (We were told that she claimed to have had most of the tables due to it being really busy and apparently short-handed - the patio was not even half-full and the inside area was maybe half-full -- if that is really busy, then I would hate to see the service when the tables are actually filled).

I also couldn't tolerate the music that was played outside, which seemed to be mostly a hip-hop type - more club-esque than what I'd expect at a "rock bar & grill". The music being played indoors seemed a lot better, and I wish we had been given an option of whether we had wanted a table indoors or out.

The only pro was the people watching, but I would have much preferred doing this as I spent my time enjoying Vegas and not unnecessarily waiting around while being subjected to bad music.

At least I know now to avoid this place on my next trip.

I liked PBR!!! To me, it was a fun time, ok food and pleasant service.  
The pro's:
--tons of TV's to watch whatever sporting event you want...and they'll change the channel, just ask!
--reasonably priced (for Vegas) bar food
--a bull...if you so desire 
--the French Fries
--the background music was fantastic!! 

The cons: my only complaint was the picnic bench seating.  It was uncomfortable and awkward.  Ask for a table, if possible.

The true American experience!!! Food is awesome, drinks are too pricey. They have a concert often at night, and the best thing ever they have a mechanic bull and believe me you get your money's worth watching people (or jumping on it like I did)

My fianc and I were walking down the strip with my sister and decided to get a drink. We passed this place and I decided I wanted to try it because of the fire on the tables. Yeah, that was a deciding factor for me lol. My fianc got an adios mother fuc*er and my sister and I got a strawberry daiquiri. My fiancs drink was strong and well work the money while my sister and I's drinks were just overpriced slushies. Pretty disappointing since it was my sister's first drink ever and because I can get buzzed off of an 8oz. glass of wine. My fianc even asked the waitress if there was any alcohol or if it was a virgin. According to her, it had 10%, same as a beer. I get buzzed off of a beer so they must have forgotten to put the alcohol in. Pretty disappointing. We won't be returning unfortunately.

Service was slow. Sat for more than five minutes before server came over and they weren't that busy. Food was cold. The hand cut fries were soggy and cold. The potato salad had no flavor. I've been to PBR's in other cities and they were good.

I wish I could give them 0 stars.

We made a point of visiting PBR while NASCAR was in town (March 9-11, 2012) only because of their PBR promotional flyers & website ads which read: Patrons who attend the high-intensity races may enjoy a 10 percent dining discount when they present their ticket stubs from the event throughout the weekend, as well as a complimentary open bar within an hour after the races finish.

I was in charge of picking the bar to enjoy the Saturday (Nationwide) race. Out of all the sports bars (or bars for that matter) in Las Vegas, I brought our group of five to PBR because of the promotion. We planned on eating and drinking for two hours and then enjoy the free drinks an hour after the race and then take 10% off the dining portion of our bill. Unfortunately things did not go that way.

I made a reservation via OpenTable for five, and when we arrived I asked for the hostess to seat us so we had a tv with a view of the race. She replied, "we have tvs everywhere, I'm sure you'll see the race." She proceeded to sit us at a booth that fit five people comfortably, yet NOT ONE TV HAD THE RACE ON - all were on college basketball. Before the hostess left I said to her, "can we change a tv to the race?" She replied, "only the manager can change the channels - I'll have him come over."

The manager does not arrive, but our waitress does. She gives us menus and takes our drink order. I tell her our predicament and she replied she'd send the manager over. TWENTY MINUTES LATER we still hadn't seen the manager and were missing our sporting event. Our waitress apologized profusely and said she didn't know what more to do - she had asked the manager to come over multiple times and change the channel for us. Just to be clear, no one was watching the tv we wanted changed. 

Upset I was being ignored and missing the race, I got up, took my bucket of beers and walked over to a table near the bar which had a view of three tvs showing the race. Next a bus boy walks up to our table and says, "you can't sit here - that table has been assigned to someone else already. You need to visit the hostess to get a table." I replied to him, "No, I am sitting here because I asked to be seated in an area with the race and was not, and your manager is too busy to come and change a damn channel for us - so I am sitting here." Of course he didn't like my answer and went to the hostess. Now the hostess comes to our table and says, "you can't sit here I have this table booked for another party." Not only did I repeat my comment, but my husband was even louder. She turned and walked away.

Our first waitress came over to our table and introduced us to our new waiter. In front of us she explained our predicament and told us the bucket of beer would be moved over to a new ticket and apologized she couldn't get the manager to change a channel for us. We told her it wasn't her fault and we would be happy now that we could see the race. She was not upset and our new waiter was happy to serve us. We thought all was on the right track.

Well, we won our bet on the race (YEAH!) but as soon as they waved the checkered flag we asked for our free drinks per the promotion. Our waiter told us the only beer selections were Bud or Bud Light. We don't drink Bud or Bud Light - so we had a well drink. It was healthy and we were happy. As soon as we finished the first drink was asked for a second. Again, we figured since the promotion was an open bar for one hour - the service would be slow and we would get at most three free drinks. Well get this: upon ordering our second well drink our waiter tells us, "oh, it's just ONE free drink." And I said, "WHAT?!"

Again, promotion read:  Patrons who attend the high-intensity races may enjoy a 10 percent dining discount when they present their ticket stubs from the event throughout the weekend, ***as well as a complimentary open bar within an hour after the races finish.*** Where does that say ONE DRINK? BULLSH*T!

At that point I ask for the check because I was through with crappy establishment. And when I asked for the bill I reminded them of the 10% dining discount. This time our waiter said, "Oh, that discount is if you don't get a free drink - it's either one or the other." My husband came unglued! I think I cursed. Our waiter said, "Let me check though, you are my first customers asking for the discount."'

Fuming, I sat at the table thinking about all the other bars we could've enjoyed the race as well as spent our out of town dollar...the food was barely average (I had a salad and my husband had a burger) and the service was horrible from the hostess & manager (waitstaff worked very hard). Our waiter returned and said, "Sorry, I was wrong, you do get 10% off your dining portion" as we all made some sort of comment about actually doing what your promotion says.

I am also going to review this horrible establishment on OpenTable too. Seriously people - this place sucked. STAY AWAY!

On first impression, I didn't want to even come into the place just solely on the decor. (Don't kill me for being honest.) I mean, the inside is really dark, there's a bull-riding contraption, and I assumed it would just be a knock off of Cabo Wabo across the hotel.

The service and food were complete opposites!

Workers were really sweet and friendly and super accomodating.

I had their pulled pork burger and baked beans and it was really good. Definitely what I was craving and I'm glad I wasn't afraid of sampsing (sampling) this joint!

They also have good happy hour and twitter specials =)

Nope. 

In an attempt to maximize our time in the sun on our late fall trip, we wandered down to PBR Rock Bar's patio after the pool at our hotel had shaded over. Situated right on the Strip, we thought it'd be the perfect spot to people watch. Side Note: People watching in Las Vegas is everything you thought it would be. Bring eye drops because they will dry out from staring so hard. 

Anyway, back to PBR. As I said, we sat outside where half the tables were full of pretty chill groups of older people having drinks and appetizers. Our waitress hated everyone. At least, she hated us and the people next to us, and the people next to those people, and the people in front of us. Yep that was everyone. Asking for menus and what brands of vodka was totally unacceptable. The scowls turned to full-on eyerolls when we wanted to order food with our drinks. How dare us. And when we asked to split the check? She nearly punched holes into the computer as she rang us up. 

Everyone has a bad day, totally get it. But go punch a bag of flour in the kitchen and suck it up like everyone else. If your day is really THAT bad, stay home. You aren't doing yourself any favors or your tables by being the witch of Vegas. And you certainly aren't receiving any great tips either, ours was below average and came with a note explaining why we undertipped. Personally I can't bring myself to do that... but my dining companions sure could, and did.

We ate/drank here 3 times in the 5 days we were staying on the strip. Great food and service! Great place to watch our home team football game, with multiple tv screens. The patio is amazing and has cozy fire places. Buy anything and get a free ride on the mechanical bull ;)

Review is for the bar only.

We came here ONLY because "Fat Tuesdays" at the Miracle Mile Shops was closed for a few hours due to some troubles w/their machines. 

What a rip off! We all got the 32 oz slushy drink for $18.( I think someone posted a picture) That thing had about 1 1/2 shots of alcohol (W E A K). I didn't even drink the entire thing, I threw it out and got a refill @ Fat Tuesdays in Cesar's Palace. 

Lesson learned.

Accept no imitations, if you want a good slushy drink in Vegas go to FAT TUESDAYS!

Stopped here around midnight on a Tuesday with a group of four.  Sat outside which was enjoyable to see the sights and sounds of Vegas.  Ordered a PBR bucket which had 6 beers. Food was mediocre bar food.  I had a footling hotdog, the rest of the crew got burgers, all in all which were mediocre bar food.  Indoors they have a bull to ride, and often have live music playing.  Outdoors was not smoke-free which wasn't particularly enjoyable, but was expected.  Overall, not a bad place to just eat and drink with friends.

Don't be fooled. This place looks great! It has an awesome patio! What looks like a "great" deal for their happy hour. 
Earlier in the day we were approached by a promoter for 2 for 1 drinks. We were actually looking for a place to eat at the time so we decided to try this place. When we sat down the table had a promotional flyer on the table. It was happy hour!! It was great, they half off draft and 2 for 1 drinks too. We all decided to get the 2 for 1 drinks. We also ordered their tailgater special. It was a bunch of appetizers for approx $50. It said it fed 4-6 people. It sounded like a great deal. Here is where it all went downhill. 
The food was cold! It tasted good but it seemed to have been sitting for a while before it got to the table. When they arrived it seemed like smaller portions. Half a pretzel? Really!? 
Then, the bill arrived and all of a sudden it wasn't 2 for 1 drinks anymore. They FAILED to tell us that on "game day" the drink specials aren't valid. NO WHERE does it say on the promotional flyer any exclusion NOR did the waitress let us know. Shady. Don't waste your time and try a different place, there are so many around.

Das PBR befindet sich am Ende der Miracle Mile Shops und hat nehmen dem Restaurant auch einen kleinen Aussenbereich, direkt am Strip.

Wir kehrten hier spontan ein, da die Fotos der Burger einfach verlocken aussahen.
Ein Tisch wurde uns schnell zugewiesen und die Damen im Service war auch schon da. Freundlich und aufgedreht, wie man es in den USA gewohnt ist.
Die Musik im Laden war etwas laut, so dass man sie nur schwer verstand, aber nun gut. ;-)

Die Karte ist sehr umfangreich und bietet fr jeden Geschmack und Hunger etwas. Von kleinen bis riesigen Gerichten. Schnell viel der Blick auf den Double Trouble, angeblich einer der grten Burger der USA, laut USA Today.
Der Kampf wurde aufgenommen und der Burger geordert. 

Das Restaurant an sich ist modern eingerichtet und erinnert etwas an das Hard Rock Caf, inklusive der Musik.

Als der Burger an den Tisch kam, waren die Augen schon gro. Das war schon ein Geschoss, den man im Ganzen gar nicht essen konnte. Also musste er abgebaut und schichtweise gegessen werden.
Geschmacklich gut. Fleisch saftig, obwohl ich den Burger well done bestellt hatte. Also rundum gut. Aber auch massig und ganz schn sttigend. 
Gerade ebenso und kurz vor dem Platzen, schaffte ich das Monster. Nachtisch ging nicht mehr rein.

Nach dem Bezahlen rollte ich aus dem Laden, anders konnte ich mich nicht mehr bewegen.
Es war lecker, aber dann auch die einzige und letzte Mahlzeit fr diesen Tag.

Wer also Hunger hat oder sich mal einer Burger-Herausforderung stellen mchte, sollte ins PBR gehen.
Worst service in town. Bartenders are catty. They won't acknowledge you even if you're in their face

I can't even rave about it being conveniently located right in front of Planet Hollywood as there are loads of other options for a drink within just as great a location.  Unfortunately all I cansay is overpriced, dirty and avery disinterested verging on rude bartender.  The fellow out front enticed us in with a two for one drink ticket.  Yet two draft beers still cost $20 and this was bluntly pointed out to me by the bartender that this was WITH the ticket.  SO consider me played and next time I'll find a friendlier place for a beer even if at the same price.

The service is very quick...not that full but busy. Food was really good and fresh. I got a couple of the Hurricane daiquiris and the were so good and they sneak up on you later lol. Our server was Denver and she was on top of it. She got 5 stars alone. The outside seating is so accommodating with the fire pits in the middle of the tables and heat lamps. Overall pretty cute place... and if you love country music.

Went here for breakfast and loved it!!  I ordered the breakfast pizza with no egg and it was delicious and really large.  I'm a pretty big eater and I could only eat half of it.  It made for a great late night snack that evening. :)  The eggs, sausage and potato plate was a hit, but the breakfast burrito plate was not.

For my drink I ordered hot tea, which tasted like it was made with water that ran through the coffee maker.  Definitely a faint coffee taste - which I do not care for.  Our service was really slow, especially considering they were not busy (8am in Vegas).  

Overall the atmosphere is relaxed/country.  We had wanted to sit in a booth, but were told they were all closed because they were going to be removing a speaker from the ceiling in that area.  First, why didn't they do that in off hours? Second, they did not do any construction in the booth area while we were there.

I would come here again for breakfast pizza!!
This is a solid mix of fun and drinking. The best part is watching drunk people ride the bull

Looking for a late night eatery!!! This is where to be.. The PBR rock and grill got all you need- food, drinks, and entertainment. 

We came in with a group of four to devour some delicious food at 1am. Thankfully the restaurant was still serving food at that time. 

- the hot wings were too crispy and dry but the hot sauce was amazing!
- my Caribbean drink could have used more alcohol
- the garden salad was regular except the croutons were too sweet 

Anyway I had a blast with my crew and would go back!!!! 

Brrrr peace!

I came in this past Thursday with a few of my girlfriends and had a blast. We came in after partying pretty hard and wanted some greasy food. This is the place to go we were told and boy were they right. The mechanical bull really was exciting. Our server was Joshua P. He was really great with drink suggestions and food selections. We had a picky eater in or group and he helped find just the right thing for her. He was really on top of refills and we had fun chatting with him. He's one of the best servers I've ever had and I would definitely recommend him as a server to anyone considering eating here. Thanks!!

My wife and I purchased a vegas.com show/dinner combo ticket, and they told us our dinner would be provided at this establishment.  We showed up around 7:15...plenty of time for a quick bite before a 9pm show IMHO.  We were seated quickly and given a set menu for vegas.com.  It did not have the full selection of their menu, but was diverse enough that I was ok with it.   That's however where the good ends.

Service was SLOW SLOW SLOW.  Waiter was nice and meant well, but I think he was overwhelmed with tables.   We both ordered the field greens & goat cheese salad....greens tasted like insecticide and barely had any dressing on them.  Took 20 min to get salads and another 20 min for Entrees.  I ordered the Shrimp & Grits....grits were odviously cheese whiz out of a jar mixed up with instant box grits.  Shrimp were grilled OK with a generous dusting of cajun seasoning.  My wife ordered the Surf & Turf...came completely cold.  I mean steak, shrimp, potato cakes...everything cold.  Wife sent it back, completely disappointed because service was so slow that there would be no time for them to remake it and make the show (show offered NO late seating).  Called the MGR over and she was apologetic, but just offered to "take care of us after the show".  Now, if the experience was so bad then why in hell would I want to return?  

I sent this to vegas.com as well because they need to know about the quality of the restaurants they choose to partner with!

We 3 women friends stopped here to eat because the outside (with NO TV, people watching, and not dark like inside) looked inviting.  The were told there were not any tables, but we pointed out 2 empty tables nearby so we were "allowed" to sit at one of them.  Strange!

Our food was small portions (except for lots of fries) for a big price, but it's Vegas I guess.  I found a much better value and much better food later at Tacos & Tequila in the Luxor.

Our waiter Thomas A was great, but someone else brought out the food and there was a slight error (which was fixed).  Our check was all on one, when we had asked for separate checks, but we got it straightened out.

We came into town for a jiu jitsu tournament that our whole team came in for. I wanted to set up a dinner for the team which is about 50 in total. I called nearly 20 restaurants in town and no one would accommodate without doing a group pricing ($40 per person on select menu) I called PBR and dealt with Scott. He said he would help me out and started working on my res. I ended up making 2 separate reservations to work around some of our team who would be working the tournament till later in the evening but not hold up tables. Scott was easy to work with and straight to the point! He ended up giving us an awesome section off to the side of the patio that gave us more then enough room! they called the afternoon of to verify our res and also see if the live music they had that night outside would be to much for us and if we wanted to be placed inside. I was very pleased with their concern and attentiveness. We had an amazing night!! Our server was a doll, our food came out quick and was delicious, the live music was great, and the regular music was good too. We will definitely return and if Scott and PBR will have us we can make this our annual spot for our Vegas Tournament! Oh and scott was also nice enough to comp two deserts for our birthday twins that came! Thanks Scott and PBR we had an amazing evening 
Many Thanks Silva Army

Wonderful birthday experience!! Our sever was amazing and the atmosphere was great! Oh and the raspberry mojito was the bomb.com. If you're ever in Vegas be sure to stop by and have a drink or two on the patio!

Only had drinks here and they were decent & somehwat cheap.  They have a mechanical bull you can ride.  But be careful!  A friend fell off wrong & ended up breaking her ankle. Not the establishment's fault, just know you sign that waiver in 15 places for a reason.  I didn't try any of the food, so I can't rate it.
Both meals arrived cold.   The service was great but the food was plain and cold.  If you are working of a hangover,  this is a good place to be.

Ok. If you are looking for a very affordable and fulfilling breakfast on he Las Vegas strip, this is the place to come. Their breakfast platter is $5!!! It comes with eggs, choice of meat, potato, & toast!!! 

The food was awesomeeee. French toast was so delicious. Service was okay but I get it it was like 9am in Vegas. 

Great spot inside planet Hollywood.

My boy and I went on a friday - 11 am -ish, I had the breakfast burrito, he had the breakfast potato skins. Both were amazing.  Portions were large, and were mouth wateringly good. My burrito, eggs, sausage, onion, mushroom, I dont even know what else was excellent- huge, aesthetically pleasing, drizzled with artful sour cream over spashes of verde salsa. My boyfriend kept pushing his tater skins on me so I could know how to make them at home. The chairs were comfy, we had a good time.

Go to a buffet... 

This was overpriced food. My gf didn't want to do a buffet bc we always do buffets but this place was overpriced. Same cost if you got a cheap buffet. 

This is a bar place but we wanted regular breakfast/brunch/lunch food and it just...wasn't good.

Food:
I ordered a chicken sandwich with my gf and they split it for us. Wtf,this was a tiny sandwich. It was falling apart as you ate it too. I was just shocked with the price or a small sandwich - $15

My gfs ordered soup and it was incredibly SALTY. They were able to change it but man... It was ad.

Ambiance: very bar scene. So I didn't expect much or the food. I bet the drinks are overpricely great. 

 Overall: skip it for breakfast-lunch, but you cn drink there
Awesome staff here. Very friendly and quick service. Great bbq ribs!  Love the patio was great for people watching and the misters kept it cool and fun. Order the cocktail bowls...very fun to share.

Our first water had something floating I it so we asked for another that one also had something floating in it so we shared one drink ..... Our server was slow. We said we didn't like the Doritos Mac n cheese and he didn't care or say anything and we are currently waiting for our check. As locals we will not return. Our servers name ?? Good question he never told us nor did he ever smile.

Where to start.... service too slow! Food over priced and over rated. They had no utensils and glasses. We asked for utensils and the waitress said they ran out, really? What are we suppose to eat our food with? Don't waist your time or money here.
Beerpong in Vegas sure why not ???????

I have been to PBR bar for drinks a few times before, but hadn't tried the food until now. I have been on a Mexican food kick all week, so to keep with that I got the chicken fajitas. The chicken had a great lime flavor to them, but for the cost, I felt like they were pretty mediocre. I could have gone to Chili's down the strip and gotten better fajitas for half the price. The guacamole looked like runny baby poop and the fajitas weren't served with any cheese. Brian decided to go out of the box and get the chicken and waffles pizza.  The pizza itself was good, but the chicken and waffles on top were extremely dry and lacked flavor. The service was really good, but the food was nothing worth getting excited about. We shared a fish bowl of margaritas with some friends of ours, which tasted really good. 100 ounces of margarita is a bit much, but they gladly give you to-go cups for any that can't be consumed at the table.

Stumbled upon this place with an out of town guest who loves the PBR.. so she had to try. We sat outside and had a great table to people watch. Service was prompt they were not trying to hard to please, but still attentive. I ordered a Sam Adams to drink, they were out of Sam and I settled with a Stella Artois... however I'm pretty sure they gave me Bud Light. My friend had a drink with "Carribean" in the name, I can't remember what it was, but reminded me of a Virgin Islands "Pain Killer" (Pussers British Rum and a little juice) it was delicious and a generous pour. 

We ordered burgers for lunch, my friend had the "American" and I had the "BBQ Burger". They were both very good and the only complaint I had is both of our buns fell apart while eating them, so some old bread, but they were still good. The fries were great and the ranch dressing delicious (it really is hard to find good ranch). 

The bill for 2 at lunch was $41.00, for the strip not bad. I have given up on the fact that Vegas has any hand made burger patties on the strip, since they are more geared for a volume based restaurant these were right out of a box. 

With all the food choices, this place is good for the patio and not much more.... unless I have out of town guests who have their hearts set on the novelty of the PBR, I won't be back.

Nice atmosphere the food was good had the wings my buddy had the nachos that were very good prices were Vegas type prices so plan on spending a good penny for some food and drinks that why the 4 stars

What a successful weekend indeed!  Celebrating with some of my faves and decided to come to PBR Rock Bar on the strip.  

It's a Sunday but they're pretty busy, got a booth and was being served by Taylor!  She's super friendly and really sweet!  So we ordered a few dishes to share:

Whiskey Dip (beef brisket dip Sammy)
Mac n' Cheese deep dried balls
Combo Platter (brisket & ribs)

In addition you could purchase a 33oz Bull Rider or 20oz Bull Fighter (you keep the glass) and the refills are $5.00.  It totally works with the live band and you definitely will not be disappointed.  The food was really flavorful (especially the deep fried tomatoes).

It was a great time with great company and delicious food.  Next time time you're in Vegas stop by and enjoy the (bull) ride!

I was staying at the Planet Hollywood and this place was in the shopping center connected to the hotel... Convienient.

They had plenty of reps passing out drink coupons and passes to ride the mechanical bull. More than a couple times friends and I got the yard margaritas with an extra shot of 151 for another few bucks.

On another night they offered a very cheap deal on bottle service inside their club side of the place.  It was Smirnoff Vodka, not the greatest, but it's better than nothing.

I'm glad I could have a good time without traveling too far from my hotel in the Summer Vegas heat.

The food was terrible. The pretzel was burnt and the spinach and artichoke dip was gross. And the service was also terrible. Didn't wait on us for probably 10+ minutes, gave us attitude and messed our order up. Don't waste your money here! Plenty of other options in Planet Hollywood.

Stopped in here for a few drinks before clubbing labor day weekend. The girls on the side walk hand out 2 for 1 drink tickets. This is somewhere to stop by and have a ton of drinks and quality is not an issue. They have a beer pong table and mechanical bull. I didn't try the food during my visit.

Had bloody Mary's which were supposed to come with a pickle which they don't do anymore even though the new menu says it does and the celery and lime look like they'd been sitting for days. They said they have a gluten free menu but no longer do one. Nachos were ok. Overall very disappointed!  Only ate an appetizer and chose to eat elsewhere. Waiter was nice though.

We are currently here celebrating my spouse's birthday and was treated with nothing less than excellent service. Our waitress Joanna was extremely tentative the whole time, while managing a lot of tables at once. She not only served us but went out of her way to find out specific tourist sites we wanted to see. She took our order for drinks, appetizers, entrees and desserts all at once and literally everything came out one after the other. I would recommend anyone stop in to get created as a valued customer.

Service was friendly and attentive. The beef brisket sandwich was awful. It was dried out beef, small quantity (not at all like the menu photo), and no BBQ sauce (needed to ask). The fajita was flavorless and the teeny tiny container of salsa was seriously a LOL moment. Overall, bad food experience and we won't return. Disappointing lunch. The venue was enjoyable due to country theme, too bad the food was terrible. Cant recommend.

This place is located on the planet Hollywood side of the strip. Right under the bridge. Perfect location and easy access. I would say the vibe of this place was really nice. Played country music, large wooden tables, & string lights.

Our servers name was Crystal. She was amazing! Her energy was what I enjoyed the most. She was so friendly and conversed with the table (a duh moment right? But you don't always get that). 

We ordered a Bloody Mary- it was ok. It was more on the spicy level which is what I look for. But a basic Bloody Mary sometimes is all you need. We also got a house salad (best house salad I've had) a Caesar (eh it was ok) &a the wings. The wings were almost breaded and really fatty inside. The ranch was what made it worse to be honest. I'm almost positive it's Hienz ranch that comes prepackaged. My cousin ordered fish & chips that she took one bite of and left. My beer came out with an inch of head- so I missed out on about two inches of what should have been more beer. I used the yelp offer for buy on get one so maybe that's why. 

Anyways, the 4 stars are for the server, staff,  & ambiance. The food is not stellar and could use a lot of fixes.

I don't think anybody is going to come here because of the food.  It's OK.  It's the ambience, attitude, and the BIG ASS drinks.  And, to watch the ladies jiggle on the mechanical bull and the hilarity when somebody gets thrown off.  I gotta say the 100oz drink I had was fairly weak.  I shouldn't have been able to finish the entire thing and not felt that tipsy.  Kinda disappointed that it was more juice than liquor.  The waitresses at the bar were a little less than attentive. But, when they did get to me, they were friendly and smiled.  I like to be served by people who at least look like they enjoy their jobs.  I would definitely say to check this place out - you'll at least get a kick out of watching people get thrown from the mechanical bull.

If i can, i will give 0 star. Discrimination placed. Just because we are asian? We are ignored, food is horrible. The waitresses are super snob. If you are not white, please do no even go here. They treated you like no body

I have always walked by the PBR Rock Bar & Grill, but never went inside until recently. I cannot believe that I have never entered this place before. The staff is so friendly. E and Jeff are amazing. The Taco Pizza and the drinks were delicious. I will definitely, be going back!

Walked into the bar and were seated at one of the high top tables. Ordered a couple of drinks. The waiter asked if we wanted to order food, I said not right now. He left and who I believe was a manager came up to us and told us we had to leave or go to the bar. I asked why and she said that if we wanted to sit at the table we need to order food. No one told us this before being seated and the bar was over half empty! The waiter returned with a $25 bill for 2 drinks that we had only taken a sip out of. I can understand having a policy like that if the bar was full and it was a busy time, but you need to make your patrons aware of it before they are seated. With a bar over half empty it just doesn't make sense.

I think the best thing about this place is the location and the atmosphere. If I would have to give stars for just that it would be 5. Really enjoyed my time here. I ordered the bucking bull fries and those were yummy!! I would recommend getting the onions on the side though. I ordered the hot wings as well and I was really shocked at how great they were! They had a crisp outside but not to much and lots of sauce. They weren't spicy enough though could have been hotter. My husband had the burger and he really enjoyed it and the serving size was huge! I hat a couple Hat benders which is an alcoholic beverage and I liked it. It had a tart sweet kick to it if that makes sense. They have a check in offer buy one drink get one drink of equal or lesser value. The service was so fast and the food was fresh.

This restaurant is right outside the Planet Hollywood entrance near the sports book, so it is very convenient. We shared sliders and a soup/grilled cheese appetizer that were both delicious! Michael at the bar kept our glasses full, and saw to our every need!

This place was so fun. Love the atmosphere, and  loved the bucking bull fries we got. We also got a giant Margarita bowl to split between 4 of us. It wasn't very strong and waayyy to sugary but it was fun. Service was great as well. Will definitely come back.

Huge bar with a million TV's hanging on the walls--a good place to watch the game. The drinks were not very good, that was definitely the low point, but the food was surprisingly decent. I was expecting it to be gross, but the chicken caesar salad was good, as was the turkey burger. my fiance ordered the buffalo dorito wings with and those were interesting--i would not recommend them. they came with a cheesy sauce on top vs. buffalo when we were expecting a buffalo sauce with doritos sprinkled on top. service was good and overall was not a bad place to come to if you are looking for a sports bar vibe.
Came for the bull. $5 per ride and an employee handles the controls. Yes!

The food was good but nothing to rave about. The brisket sandwich was good but the brisket was a bit dry. The pizza with brisket had a nice kick to it which was a good surprise. The Mac and cheese with Doritos was underwhelming. We were so excited to try it only to realize that it simply tasted like Mac and cheese. The Doritos didn't even give it much crunch. I would go back but would order something different.

This place gets its stars from me purely based on location! It is great for people watching. The service was good, but the food was ok. I probably will never go here again. Everyone I was with said their food was good, but mine was just ok. I'm not sure if it was 3 days of partying or what, but after eating here I felt horrible. I just was not impressed. The atmosphere is fun though!
Cool setting on the strip with good food, great service and some drink specials that help take the sting out of strip prices

Beers and Bulls!

What happens when you take drunk girls in hooker dresses and mount them on a mechanical bull?  Hilarity ensues, along with pantie shots.  Oh, and you don't have to walk through the casino to take a leak, cause the pisser (that's how cowboys say bathroom) is right there inside the bar!

A group of four of us ate here on 02/03/18, the food was good and the prices were very reasonable BUT the service was horrible!  We waited almost an hour for our meal.  We were never asked if we want another drink or anything else and when we were ready to leave our server was nowhere to be found.  We walked up to the bar to pay for our meals and were told that we had to give it to our server (who disappeared).

I was hanging around the planet hollywood sportsbook watching the basketball game I had money and I was getting real hungry and decided to stop at pbr rockbar to eat as Im always walking past it but never stop in. All the waitresses are hanging around by the entrance trying to get people to come in which is kind of annoying. It was dead as it was only 4pm, but I just wanted to go sit at the bar, eat, drink, and watch the game. As I was just walking towards the entrance a waitress asked if I wanted to come in and eat, I said yeah that I was just going to the bar, she says no you're sitting at my table in my section, as she was kinda cute I got guilted in and said ok. She sat me at the table right next to the entrance which was more annoying as it was further away from any tvs. I told her I wanted to watch the game so she had the manager change the closest tv to that game, which the tv was far away and I couldnt really see it anyways. The waitress was very friendly as she made several recommendations and was very upbeat and energized. I ordered the buffalo chicken sandwich with no blue cheese, and of course when it came out it had blue cheese on it, which I cant stand. But I just picked it off. Waitress came by to see if everything came out the way I asked and I told her it came with blue cheese on it and she asked if I wanted to return it to the kitchen and have them remake it, I said no its not that big of a deal as I can just scrape it off. It was a monster piece of chicken, part of which was just bad meat which I was immediately disgusted by, it was served on a brown wheat type bun which is strange and tasted like shit. This place seems like a cool place to drink and party as it has a college bar atmosphere which I like, but as far as the food (atleast that day or maybe just what I ordered) was not very good.

Food was decent.  However, the service was poor, mostly at the end.  I was pulling my wallet out to grab a credit card as the server was leaving the ticket, so it should have been beyond obvious we were ready to go.  However, 10 minutes later we were still sitting there with the credit card on the table and the server had not been back.  My wife went to the restroom, and he still hadn't been back even after that.  I went up to pay at the bar and was told my server had to ring it up.  I told them to get his happy ass over there.  After a couple more minutes I just left some cash and we left.

First time coming to this place two years ago was okay, but went there again for our second time this  weekend  while in vegas for some drinks and appetizers and we enjoyed our time there. Service was quick and my mojito tasted perfect. My boyfriend and I still can't get over how delicious the buffalo wings were! So juicy and tasty! Our waitress was upbeat and friendly.

Really cool place!!!
Looking for some late night eats after a long flight and this place hit the spot. I don't know if I would call it 5 star cuisine, but definitely good bar finger food and great beer.
Some added entertainment was the mechanical bull... the people riding this bull and getting tossed was like a train wreck! You just couldn't look away! 
We just went for finger food but I have a feeling we'll be back this week to try a burger, they looked YUM!!! 
If I was a local, this would definitely be a regular spot for us.

Timely service, American food.  This looks like a fun place for the evening crowd in Las Vegas.  We stopped in for a quick lunch bite after the girl on the sidewalk offered us 10% off our check.  It was early lunch in Las Vegas, so not much crowd.  The service was quick because of that.  However, a few things surprised us. Our waitress went on break, and another gal came by to check on us (This was a first after a week of eating out) They come by and take your photo, then offer it to you with a souvenir frame.  If you decline, the price WILL get cheaper.  They have a mechanical bull and a tire swing tied to the rafters if you are feeling brave.
The staff here will talk you into buying very large drinks. We were very drunk by 11am. We had a great time!!

Came across this restaurant for a nice dinner. The food was really good.  The place is a western rock bar. There is a section of the place for music and dancing. There is also a bull riding device. Sunday nights they have a bull riding competition
Wide variety of food items on the menu. Pizzas, burgers, salads, fish, specialties, appetizers. We had the BBQ chicken pizza and chicken fajitas. The pizza was thin crust juicy and full of cheese chicken with red onions.  The chicken fajitas were served on a hot iron plate with peppers onions. Served with flour tortillas salsa,sour cream, and guacamole. 
The server sharece was very friendly and attentive to making our dinning experience a fantastic one. Highly recommend this place. 
You have to Yelp check in too.

I like the location and atmosphere - the patio is right on the strip.  The booth seats are too low for the tables though so we sat at a high table.  We had the mac n cheese balls and the $4.99 breakfast which was the BEST value on the strip!  I will go back for that menu item.

If i could give this place any stars it would be zero. I left my photos which were purchased on a table top outside in the bar area, so when I realized I left them behind, I called to ask if they were put away in a lost and found they told me to "call back in the morning, we're closed" when it was 12:30am and YELP says they close at 2am. What bar closes at 12:30 am in Vegas? Also, our $65 bowl fruit drink was not worth it. I ended up buying 2 Coronas for $18. Probably won't be coming back.

We visited on Saturday morning for breakfast and college football. We were promptly greeted and led to a table beside the bar.  The restaurant and bar were maybe 25% full. We sat for 20 minutes while multiple employees walked by without acknowledging us. I believe it is the first time we have ever left a restaurant without being served. No one seemed to notice and definitely no one cared.

This place is pretty cool! The food was great! If your just looking for a burger, chip and dip type of place, then this is the right spot for you.

I highly recommend the artichoke dip and chips...AMAZING!!! The drinks are strong and with each meal you get a free pass to ride the bull!

The bull ride is so much fun and i did it about 5xs and the crowd are pretty cool ,fun and nice!

Good food with a fun location right outside Planet Hollywood on the strip. Get a seat outside for some great views of the strip. Food is pretty good beers are cold but it's typical bar and grill type food.

I LOVE this place! I wish I could give it 10 stars!  

We went on the last Sunday of the regular football season. They have TVs as far as the eye can see, a mechanical bull that you can ride free with your receipt (there's not enough alcohol in all of Nevada for me to do that) and the bartender Jennifer is awesome!  Don't fuck with her but she's great if you get on her good side, which thankfully we did. Haha. 

The menu had some different items on it, like nachos with BBQ potato chips and the atmosphere was great. Avoid Cabo Wabo and come here instead!
I mean it was alright service was OK the nachos were just alright. The prices are a little too high as well for the atmosphere
Not a great breakfast place at all.  Poor service and just blah food.  Who "runs out" of hollandaise sauce?  Gross!
Looking for breakfast and a bloody we stopped in, had a Bloody Caesar and the brisket skillet, both were very good! Will go back

Stopped here before a show in PH. We went here because everywhere else seemed too busy for the amount of time we had. I ordered the pulled chicken, which was dry and bland. My friends ordered the pulled pork which was up to par, and the salmon which she said was good but she says everything is good. The fries were the best part of the meal for me and along with reasonably priced beer, was the only saving point for this restaurant. Service was slow and the waitress didn't really seem to care. She apologized for taking 15 minutes to get to our table but then continued to provide mediocre service.

We randomly came here for breakfast and the food was satisfying. I had a kickstart which includes potatoes, eggs, tatettots, and pancakes to kickstart my day of drinking and a margarita to get things started! Service was mediocre. The food was so fulfilling that I wasn't hungry until the evening. We got a receipt for a free bull ride!
I have been here 2-3 times now, I don't live far. But, every time friends come in and visit we go here for lunch. I had a burger, was very good. Prices weren't too bad either, service was great!

Horrible. Overpriced. Precooked. I really couldn't say it any simpler. I ordered the chicken mac n cheese foolishly expecting actual Mac n cheese. It was a bowl of shells with the runniest liquid cheese, devoid of flavor. No amount of shredded cheese and pepper could save this dish. The food came out so fast it's obvious that it's precooked. If you're looking for a fun loud place to drink, watch a game or the people walking the strip then this might be a good place. If you want a good meal cooked to order then go somewhere else
fun cool place thats has ok food..they do how ever have a bull to ride. the staff was a little lacking in friendlyness.

Food was good, music so loud it was hard to hear what my date was saying, and our server was super nice. I just gotta say, though, don't seem so surprised when I show you my Yelp check-in deal (Buy 1 Get 1 free drink). I mean, for a second there I wondered if maybe I'd checked into the wrong bar, and seeing as we were in Vegas, walking into unexpected places is totally a possibility. Thankfully, our server was cool and did eventually give us the deal. That breakfast served all day was legit! Gotta love that late night white chocolate/raspberry french toast! Nice selection of food overall and the fries and patty melt my husband ordered were delicious.
La food est correcte mais finalement pour le prix du burger $15 je m'attendais a mieux. a valait un 5guys, pas beaucoup plus. En revanche musique sympa et service hyper rapide (trop?)
This place was awesome ! They have amazing drinking offers! And delicious appetizers ! You can totally get pooped faces here on the strip of under 50 bucks!

Ate here twice the last time we were out. On friday our flight got into town in between lunch and dinner.  We ordered beers and split a burger and it was around $20.00.  The burger was plenty big and pre split into two portions with two portions of fries....most places wont do this for you.  shortly after we ordered jalepeno corn bread was brought out to our table which was a nice little snack.  All of the wait staff were friendly and would stop to check if we needed anything.  it was a bit loud, but what bar isnt.  

The sunday afternoon when we ate there it was busier than Friday afternoon.  I would assume because of the games on tv.  Although it was busier it didnt show with the service.  The service was just as good as the slower day.  I was impressed!

Sometimes the low yelp rating just doesn't reflex the business. That's how I feel about PBR.  From the outside it just looks like cheesy bar, but the food is pretty good. I went with a group of 6, everyone liked it and it's a great spot to watch a game, which is what we were doing.
The drinks are cold and yummy! The food was really just ok! The place was not lively at all. My drinks were messed up but they were quickly fixed. Spend your money at a different place!

I got the Mos Melt and it didn't even come out as burger, it was a sandwich.. weird.. 

It wasn't bad. Get it Medium-well, its close to Well-done. 

The pickle on the side was terrible, it wasn't juicy, it was dry and old.. 

I got their firecracker coleslaw on the side, nothing sparking here.. (it was just coleslaw, nothing spicy, or a kick of anything). 

Dim environment, if you're into that kind of thing. 

They completely forgot someones order until we said something (while everyone was halfway done). Not the waiters fault, it was the kitchen.

I was in heaven here . . . . on a Sunday with every NFL game within view, and close enough of a view that I could see who missed that catch!  One thing to note (I don't know if it's a good thing or bad because listening to someone else's game would be annoying), but there is NO GAME SOUND -- they play music instead.  Like I said, maybe not such a bad thing.  Atmosphere was perfect -- restrooms are IN the restaurant, not across the casino floor --- BONUS!  

The food is ok, just ok.  Thus the one less star . . . it's bar food, though they try to make it better than bar food.  Though we only tried breakfast items, so I can't judge too hard.  :)
