Beer in a bucket was the special -- $20 for 5 bottles domestic of your choice.  Not too bad . . . don't order draft, those are something like $8/ea and after a bucket's worth, that gets a little pricey for football watching. 

They do have some minimums though -- if you come during the early games and stay for the late games, there is a $40 food and beverage minimum that needs to be met for the afternoon.  We had no problems making this with the price of the food/drinks, but just a good thing to know. 

P.S. when you've had enough of the games, there is a bull you can try out too. . . . if not for you, watching is always very entertaining!  We did laugh our a**es off at a woman who thought the had it down, but didn't.  Ouch!
Great happy hour deals. I love the boneless buffalo chicken!  Beer prices are reasonable for Vegas. Awesome people watching outdoor seating area. We frequent this place whenever in Vegas.

Had lunch on a saturday afternoon. Food was great! We sat outside and enjoyed the people watching. The giant burger my husband had was literally falling apart it was so rare. :( We didn't complain though, he was hungry so he ate the outer edges and the fries. I  had the pulled pork and it was fantastic. The portions were huge. The price was way higher than it should be of course, but comparable to any sports bar/grill restaurant on the strip. Service was good.

I had my birthday meal here and was able to get a table with a view of the Bellagio Fountains. The Barbecue Burger was awesome, It's huge! My sister had a chicken and waffles pizza that she said was good as well and we got to sit outside. Best Birthday ever!

I've been meaning to stop in for awhile now. Last year I passed by on my way back to the Elara and they were playing a lot of hip hop! I was super tempted, but didn't go inside.

During my most recent trip, the manager stop my sister and I while we were walking past to go to Halo Bar (yayyy for $5 patron shots). Gave us a couple of buy one get one free coupons, so we stopped in to check things out. It was pretty early in the evening, so it wasn't too crowded. The bartender was quick and friendly. Overall a nice stop on our roaming venture.

I will most definitely be back for the bull ride and the hip hop!
I had a mini vacation in Vegas and tried this place out. Not to bad. The wait wasn't that long. They have the motorized bull there and tons on TVs to watch sports. Will return.
Breakfast was perfect. Shared a chicken and waffles plate along with a Traditional Latino plate Chilaquiles. Would definitely go back next time I'm in town. Se lo recomiendo a todos.

DONT DO IT! Was standing out front with a group of friends when a promoter from this bar convinced us to go inside by offering two for one drinks and saying that we could ride the mechanical bull. We turned her down several times but finally agreed to go inside. We sat down at the bar and the waitress gets our drinks (Luke warm beers) and says "we're closed so you guys can take your drinks and go" just like that. And they wouldn't let us ride the bull! Over priced. Unprofessional and undertrained staff. Had the feel of a Chuck E. Cheese for old bikers.
First of all, the place is conveniently located. Good music plus the bull riding is very fun to watch.

Stopped in here for a quick lunch while walking thru the Miracle Mile Shops. WORST food experience in Las Vegas!! Waitress warned us away from several items - should have been our clue to have a beer and go somewhere else for food... Nachos were 12 chips of pasty cardboard and the boneless wings were fried to shoe leather texture. Do yourself a favor - eat somewhere else!

This place is perfect for those times in Vegas when you're stumbling around, just about on empty, and you could use a beer and a shot to get your night going again. They've got some tasty $5 shots, and beers are as low as $3. I think. Don't quote me on that. My prior statements clearly indicate that attention to detail is likely at a low during those times.

Worst chilaquiles ever. The tortillas and cheese were congealed into one hard mass in the middle of my plate. I tried to eat some of it and realized that would have been a terrible idea, so I had the egg on top and the sauce. When I complained later to the waiter and said it should be taken off the bill, his response was, "Well it looks like you ate most of it." Unprofessional and rude. But they did take it off. Also,$12 for an awful Bloody Mary that was the color of strawberries and mostly ice. My friend had an equally horrible grilled cheese with processed cheese. Would never return.
Yelp check in! Best thing ever! Totally unpretentious from the rest of vegas. If you sit in the outside bar you can watch people riding the mechanical bull. It can be entertaining.
Good food on the Vegas Strip. Prices are about the normal price range for Vegas...too much but unfortunately the norm for the area.
The food took 45-50mins to come out. Food was cold and didnt have much seasoning to it. Staff was friendly, but they dont communicate well. I dont see myself coming back.
Great for people watching.  Good food and drinks.  It's a safe spot to stop off at for a quick bite.  I definitely recommend the Potatoe chip nachos.

Had the chicken mac and cheese.  I was super disappointed.  The Mac and cheese was soupy and lacked seasoning.  The chicken looked like it was cooked on a foreman grill.

I did have a double shot of knob creek, which was good but pricey.

We stopped here to eat because we wanted something with an outdoor patio so we could people watch- well me more then the husband. The first place we were seated we had to move because there was a table of 4 women and 3 of them were smoking. I thought smoking was against the law at restaurants in Las Vegas? Either way it was gross. We ordered 2 teas, bucking bull potatoes, a Caesar salad, and steak &eggs. The food was just ok. I I wish we had eaten somewhere else honestly. The potatoes were smothered in cheese sauce(sounds great right?) and the bacon was more like bacon bits vs nice crispy bacon. My salad was just blah. All the dressing was at the bottom, the pieces of lettuce were huge and not too fresh looking. The corn bread croutons were not crunchy.  I feel like we wasted $50. We should have eaten at Mon Ami Gabi.

The menu here has changed drastically and is not what it used to be. Their menu use to be incredibly diverse and was a drunkards orgasm. This is only the place to come if you don't want to blow a hole in your wallet and you want some decent food.

Buyer beware. We came here for a late lunch and they had a promotion for happy hour from 2-6 on Sunday's. We ordered 2 for 1 cocktails only to be told AFTER we ordered that it wasn't available on football days. When we questioned it, we were told that the marketing department should put an asterisk to clear up confusion. Last time I checked, football has been in season for a few months now. Clearly, they did this on purpose and hope people are dumb or wasted enough not to question. Poor management.

We had a blast here on our last day in Vegas. Our waiter was super friendly and helpful, the drinks were good although pricy (hey it's Vegas) and the food we had was excellent. If you go here try the house nachos served on house made kettle chips they are awesome ! Free mechanical bull rides with a drink purchase and man you have to try that out, it is a blast even if it was a short ride for me! I posted a few pictures of the menu of your curious, it's not cheap but nothing in Vegas is! Typically there are guys out front handing out two for one drink cards, grab one and head in and scope it out ! Plenty of TV's to catch a game or whatever your interested in, the music is good and the atmosphere is excellent !

A group of us went to PBR Rock Bar & Grill after we decided the line at the Earl of Sandwich was too long.  Boy do I regret it.  By the time we sat down, ordered and got our food I could have gone through the line at Earl of Sandwich about 6 times.  Our lunch took over 2 hours.  We had to wait a little while for the table but most of the time was spent waiting for our food which was NOT worth it.  Some of our meals were cold, and all were just not good.  Service was terrible.  When she did come by she was not at all polite.  I'm sure the fact that we were all hungover and just wanted some food did not help.

Head over to Earl of Sandwich instead for a much better and much faster meal.
One Star Because there's nothing lower. Got seated and forgotten for half hour. I walked out. Horrible service ! Time is money
Must get the Doritos Mac and cheese and the ribs! They are so delicious even the half portion is filling. And the corn on the cob is cooked perfectly!
They serve mediocre, small portioned breakfast here.  If you are at Planet Hollywood, it's noon, and you want breakfast really bad, go here.  Otherwise, I'd recommend elsewhere...

This place was pretty awesome! We went at about 3 pm on a Wednesday, not busy at all. Not sure about the night life but for food and some drinks my husband & I really enjoyed it! I will definitely go back next time I'm in Vegas!
Great food. Crappy service. Will not be going back. Also why does a country bar play hard rock and pop music.

We came here after a day at the pool and STARVING.  We were seated quickly and got our food just as quick.  I ordered the Catfish Po'Boy with fries.  One of the best Po'Boys I've had out of New Orleans!  My friends ordered the Veggie Stack, Shredded Pork Burger, BBQ Burger, and the Black and Bleu Burger.  Everyone thought their food was really good and everyone said they would totally come back next time.  You also get a free bull ride if you present your receipt. (Unfortunately, We didnt take advantage of that this trip)

I think next time we come, we will try to take advantage of their Happy Hour deals and possibly even ride the bull? ... ;)

Dorito Crusted Mac n Cheese $5 (3/5 NOMs). 
Vegas Brunch, Whenever I encounter a weird food experiment I just have to try it. This is like mixing my two favorite things! Doritos and Mac n Cheese. Overall the dish was good, but not amazing. I wish there was more doritos mixed with Mac n Cheese. I want the whole thing to be orange! Most likely if I come back, this is a one time order dish for me. 

Breakfast Burrito $10 (3/5 NOMs). 
Lets have giant Vegas brunch, Dam that thing is ginourmouse. I was very surprised how big this burrito was. Though the size was the only surprise in there. While there is a lot going inside, it was a bit weak. Tasted kind of bland to me. I do give them high points for adding crazy amount of bacon!

I teetered between 3 and 4 stars primarily because this was between okay and 'hey this is pretty good'.  My husband liked it a lot so 4 it is.  We actually came for a late dinner one night walking back from the Luxor to Paris.  There was no wait to get into the restaurant (score in Vegas on a Friday night) but man was it loud with all the fun they were having in the bar area.  Service was really good and attentive and the menu had a lot of options.  I went with the grilled cheese/tomato bisque and the Hubs went with the steak & eggs (9.95 people).  I was pleasantly surprised at the prices here with everything being mostly overpriced on the strip these days.  The food was pretty good for this type of restaurant.

We came back on Sunday morning actually for breakfast/brunch before heading to the airport since Planet Hollywood is right next to Paris and it was a quick walk.  My husband went for the steak & eggs again, and I tried their breakfast pizza.  I would say the breakfast pizza was okay, and I should have gone with the classic breakfast (4.95).  The service was great again so we would definitely come back if only for the price point here and service, with decent food.

Let me first start off by saying, I started this Yelp account solely on the experience here. 

Let's see, where shall I begin....before even going in, we were looking at the menu on the outside at which one of the hostess gave us a 10% off if we decided to eat there. We saw some entrees we would eat on the menu so we went in. First, the waiter was very friendly. We went during lunch. It wasn't busy at all. It apparently was happy hour but they said you had to go to a separate bar however, no one was at that bar. 

Once we were ready, we ordered our drinks, appetizer and food. Our lunch came out before our appetizer. When the waiter realized it, my husband refused it at that point but the manager came out and said she would comp it so we agreed to take it, even though it was late and pointless. 

The food was average. The sweet tea was delish though!! 

While waiting to receive our bill, one of those outside camera ladies came up and asked if we would like our picture taken. She had a very strong accent so it was really hard to understand her but just said "sure" anyway. When she came back after developing the photos and showing us the cost, we refused and she was a bit annoyed and rude about it. Whatever.

Once we got our bill, we noticed the appetizer was not comped. We didn't say anything cause we figured if we got comped for the appetizer, we wouldn't use the 10% off. Then the waiter noticed we had the 10% off so he said "oh, I didn't see that, I will adjust the bill." When he came back, the amount wasn't even touched. We paid for the appetizer we didn't want since it was late but agreed to take cause we were told it would be comped AND we didn't even get the 10% off they gave us at the door.

Will we be back?? NO!! I recommend you stay clear of this place and their false advertisement!!!!!!

Came here, since the line at Earl of Sandwich was literally a "miracle" mile long. Haha

Food was pretty good. It's Just your typical, American food joint. I had the pulled pork sandwich with a side of fresh fruit. There was a generous portion of pork and it was tender and juicy. It definitely tasted mass produced though. No worries, that's probably why the food comes out so quickly. The bar area/dcor is pretty cool. There's lots of TVs, so this place could potentially be a great spot to eat/drink and watch some games. Very fair food prices. They also got a mechanical bull there, which probably equals wardrobe malfunctions and fun times. 

A little about my credentials:
I first got into cooking & food when I was in college. After being rejected by numerous girls and getting zero action, I decided it was time for a change. I needed a new makeover to boost my geeky, engineering image. I applied for a cooking position at a Mediterranean-Italian  Restaurant near my home and learned to cook all sorts of pastas and dishes. I never became a professional chef, but I continue to enjoy & love food. 9 years later and 55 lbs heavier, I have a new passion for traveling and trying different foods around the world.

This is a decent option of you need food late at night and want to roll in looking like garbage after a long flight. I had the pulled pork sandwich and my wife had a burger. They were both good, but nothing that you couldn't get elsewhere. They had Angry Orchard on tap, so I was pretty happy about that.

First, the hostess looked plain annoyed when we requested a seat. not a great start. after about a 20 minute wait, we were seated. after getting waters, took more than TEN minutes for our server to come back and take our order...

then, waited THIRTY+ minutes just to get TWO HOT DOGS (which were 'eh' at best).

in summary, the food is B-/ C+ at best, not as good as TGIF or Chilis.  overpriced.  extremely crappy service provided by folks who clearly have no interest in making customers happy.
Good quality food, good quality pricing and service. Much better than BWW around the corner.

This was the worst meal we had on our trip to Las Vegas. The service stunk and the food was mediocre. Our waiter forgot about us and we had to ask somebody else for our re-fills. Also a couple of orders were slightly messed up.

Plus one star for the sweet potato tots. You can do a lot better on the Strip.

The servers had major attitude when asking where the restroom was. Our server assumed we were young and not going to drink or tip. His attitude changes once he realized we were all in our 30's.  Appt were good other then that just ok.

we were here for xmas week on family vacation. stopped in for brunch on the patio our 1st morning....loved it. ended up back for xmas dinner and also amazing. service was slow at some points, but we chalked that up to holiday rush...everyone on staff was really helpful i, house and suggesting other items for us to see on our trip. great place and great food to match!

I was in Vegas this weekend with a group of 9 girls for a bachelorette party. We stayed at Planet Hollywood and decided to hit up the PBR Rock Bar & Grill on our way out and to get our bride to be on their awesome mechanical bull. 

We had a reservation and they seemed to not be able to find it, but got is up pretty quickly. The host were friendly, asked how our bachelorette party was going so far and were very helpful. 

Once we were sat the next half hour SUCKED. I don't want my rant to be the firsxt thing you read so if you'd like to hear about our shitty server read about him at the end. 

After 45 mins, barely getting our water, going to the manager 2 times already.....I go to the manager once more....I feel like a bitch but come on. The manager says he (Kim) and the other manager (Josh) will go ahead and take care of our table personally. By the time I get back to our table Josh is handing out our shots he said he wanted to compliment us. This got our mood going back in the right direction and our order was placed and we were on our way to an awesome dinner. The food was amazing, I had The Boss Salad, and the fried pickles and jalapeno poppers were great. The other girls loved their food as well. The managers both checked on us ever couple mins, filled waters, cleared plates, go utensils, and brought everything we needed. The manager Josh looked like Clark Kent and one of our girls even told him so, he took it with a chuckle but didn't open his shirt, so who knows, he might be! The bussers were very helpful along side the managers, and definitely saved the day! 

Thanks Josh and Kim for making it up and turning a disaster around! Josh even brought us bull riding tickets and we got our bride up on that bull! If it hadn't been for the dick server, this would have gotten 5 stars. Loved the food, environment, host, bussers, bull, and of course the managers. Say hi to Josh and Kim if you go by and let them know you heard about them on Yelp.

The bad parts of dinner:
Our server took a few mins to approach us, and said he'd get us a round of waters, while he was there a host came up saying they could hook us up for a better table outside. We said that sounded great and would wait to order our food until we got out there. We waited 10 mins, no water, busser came by with water and the server sent him away with our water saying we were moving. (maybe he didn't want to carry our water outside?) Waited 10 mins, no water. I mentioned it to our server again and jokingly said maybe we should be given shots since we've been waiting so long for water. Waited 10 more mins, still no water. I'm at this point thirsty and annoyed and all the girls are talking about how long it's been. I go to the host, ask for a manager, explain what's going on, and they said they'd tell the manager. We have a manager stop by, I explain what's going on, and he said he'd get us a round of shots. 

We see the manager by the back talking to the server and look at us, so I know he's talking about us. Waited 10 more mins, still no water, and we haven't seen our server. We grab a busser and ask for water and have it within 2 mins. I go to the host stand again and this time a new manager is walking up and I explain our situation. I couldn't believe we had been there so long and had barely gotten our water. The manager says he'll take care of it and we see both managers then talking to the server. I think the servers name was Tony? Not sure he even told us. He then comes to our table, confronts us by starting with, "What's the problem here, I got you your water, I thought you were moving, it's not my fault". He then asks us if we want a new server and as everyone is just looking down because they can't believe we're being confronted, I blurt out a yes please and he turns around and storms away. This server is going to lose the restaurant business. How ballsy for him to confront his table like that.

Great spot for drinks,breakfast lunch and dinner~ cool atmosphere~ had the classic breakfast today , eggs, bacon tater tots and toast~ but I've been here before and burgers are great, big enough to share~

Bought a package deal with dinner and the V Variety show (which was awesome ). Had 2 choices for dinner and I picked PBR Rockgrill, BIG MISTAKE! It was horrible all around. First off not a big sports fan and there was a game going with a lot of loud rowdy people (who offers a sports bar to theater people? I'm from outta town I'm thinking rock bar will be similar to Hard Rock Cafe). It was so loud in there couldn't even talk to each other. Then as part of the deal our choices were EXTREMELY  limited. We had our choice of salad, salad veggies salad or ribs. I got a cesar salad and they gave me a side since my other option was salad. I picked deviled eggs thinking I 
could add them to my salad. But they were hard and tasteless. That was definitely not a cesar dressing it was horrible and the croutons were hard and chewy. Then for dessert we picked strawberry shortcake. It was an old store bought donut cut in half with canned strawberries and whipped cream. HORRIBLE!!!! I would never go back there and never recommend it to anyone. Save your money and your taste buds!
Great place for breakfast!  Fast, friendly and food was hot!  Best screwdrivers in town.  Crystal was an amazing waitress.

0 stars for service, 3.5 stars for the food, 10 stars for the absolutely amazing manager who helped make a terrible experience better. Will come back next time I'm in Vegas purely because of the strong management here.

We had a Groupon for $40 of food and drinks...  Located in the Planet Hollywood casino, this is an all-around OK place for a casual meal or bar snacks. Along with some entertainment.  

If you have a Groupon, they REQUIRE you make a reservation.  This isn't exactly a reservation type place, but you must do it.  When you call, they will ask you if you want "outside or inside".  The correct answer to that question is going to be "inside" --  unless it's December.  This place gets some direct sunlight and it is smoking hot on that patio - sit inside with the AC. 

I had an order of potato skins (wasn't that hungry...  we ate all the way to Vegas!) and she had a pizza.  My potato skins were OK... very standard.  Could have been frozen.  But not objectionable.  Her pizza was as big as a coffee table and also just OK.  The crust was a little over-done, but again it was certainly edible.  

If you're lucky, free entertainment will present itself with brave (or drunk) people riding the mechanical bull.  The service was surprisingly friendly and efficient.  Better than expected.

If you get a Groupon for this place, it's a pretty decent deal for grabbing a snack and a few drinks.  And maybe a show too.
Food was meh. Just wanted the corn on the cob from the photos. It's bar food nothing worth writing about ;)

This was horrible!  There is not a nice or diplomatic way to put it.  So disappointed it is unreal.  First, we ordered show tickets through LasVegas.com and the dinner package included the tickets to the PBR Rock Bar and Grill.  We were able to walk right up and be seated right away. Great, looks good.  Then the hostess gives us this "special" menu.  Limited menu is what it should say. I mean...you get no choice for an appetizer...really it was not even an appetizer, it was the house salad...just a plain green salad.  No choice of salad dressing.  Just that is that and no substitutions.  Mind you, the PBR Rock Bar and Grill has a pretty decent sized menu.  I had looked it up online and was wanting the California Chicken Sandwich all day!  Nope, not gonna happen.   The entre consisted of 5 choices.  Two of them were salads, macaroni and cheese, vegetable fajitas (who wants that!) and then ribs.   So pretty much the only decent choice was ribs!  Why not cut out the salad and dessert and just let someone order what they want to eat.  Seriously...the salad and dessert were not wanted and wouldn't have been ordered.  We sat there looking at our pathetic menu for 25 minutes waiting for someone to even acknowledge that we were there.  Seriously, 25 minutes and for an already irritated person, this was like an hour.  Our waiter finally showed up.  We ordered our drinks...a beer and a soda as well as the food for dinner and the dessert, they had us order it all at once.   I ordered Mac and Cheese and other half ordered ribs.  Drinks took another 15 minutes and mine was diet...I did not order diet.  Nasty.  Seriously waited another 20 minutes to tell the waiter that it was the incorrect soda.  The bus boy brought salads.  Green salad with a couple croutons and pieces of radishes.  Ranch was the dressing served...Gross.  I was so hungry, ate mine.  Other half does not like ranch dressing so he didn't even eat his.  Another 25-30 minutes and our food comes out.   The ribs looked decent, but it was just like 4 ribs covered in BBQ sauce on a piece of bread??  Side of regular mac and cheese with it.  Mine was the PBR mac and cheese.  NASTY!  It was disgusting.  Cold and watery.  I cannot believe they serve this to people.  Just horrible.  I ate a few bites and watched my other half finish his ribs.  I mean, this was bad, not good in any way.  I couldn't even complain because the waiter didnt come back.  If you are going to serve of a minimal menu then at least make the food good.  Seriously.  This was a joke. How do you mess up Mac and cheese.  Then there was a dessert that came with dinner.  You got a choice of strawberry shortcake or root beer float.  I wanted neither, but when we ordered our food we had to place our dessert order as well.  Weird!  Annoyed to say the very least.  So we just said one of each when we ordered.  (Mind you, I would not have ordered any of these options if I had been able to order off the regular menu...none of these...not one!)
Strawberry shortcake was a cold, hard, non iced donut with whipped cream and some strawberries.  Not good... It was not restaurant quality.  It was, yeah I got some left over four day old plain Krispy Kremes and a can of whipped cream...grrrr.    No, never mind.   Four day old Krispy Kremes would probably still taste good. Grrrrr. Then his float was just a scoop of ice cream and a bottle of root beer with it on the side.  Not prepared.  Just a glass, scoop inside and a bottle served with it.  This whole night was terrible.  I honestly have not had such a bad experience in a restaurant in years.  The food was bad, service was bad, the place was not full, so there was just no excuse.  It was just ridiculous all the way around.   Over an hour of waiting for horrible bar food.  The only thing that saved this night was that the show we went to was great.  This place I would avoid like the plague!  Not a good restaurant at all.
The cost of the tickets and the show package should have allowed a decent menu or allow someone to choose from the regular menu and nix the salad and dessert that we didn't want anyway. This was not a deal at all.   We would have much rather just bought the show tickets and then bought dinner some where else...McDonald's would have been a thousand times better.  This place really didn't deserve any stars but that was not an option for me.
My advice to LasVegas.com... There are many other restaurants to choose from for packages.   Pfftt..
Great spot to sit outside and watch the football games. Awesome bartender Meagan at the outside bar b

PBR is one of my favorite places in Vegas. It has a very country theme to it with a mechanical bull. We eat at this place at least once every time we come to Vegas. The food is absolutely stellar and it's reasonably priced. My absolute favorite meal here, and I'm not usually a big meat person, is the brisket grinder. It's brisket, with onion rings, roasted red pepper and aged white cheddar on a grinder. It is so awesome. And you can get tator tots. The people we've taken with us have all loved their food as well. My fiance had a burger that had pulled pork and cole slaw on it and he can't wait to have it again.

PBR is right in the middle of things. I sat on the balcony and had a great view of the Vegas strip. The drinks seemed a little pricey at $12 dollars a pop, but the were quite tasty with appropriate alcohol content. I tried the Chicken Avacado Burger and it was good - possibly a little dry. The fries were just ok. Two burgers, two drinks and an average tip totalled almost $70. Seemed a little high, but I guess you're paying for the location. I really enjoyed the outdoor heat lamps and the view inside of guests trying to ride the mechanical bull.

PBR was our back-up restaurant before a show.  The food was as expected, nothing great but nothing bad - the french fries are damn good  Our server was quite nice and attentive.

My beef is with the hostess - we were seated right away (we had a reservation), but as soon as we were seated, we noticed the table was uneven.  Not the legs are off/stuff napkins under one side kind of uneven, but the top of the table coming off the supporting column. 

We mentioned this to our server (Crissy), who immediately volunteered to fix, then after realizing the issue, went to get us a new table.  The hostess came over, angry, and said there were no other tables right now - because this was our fault?  There was a high-top, which we took, but it was completely the wrong attitude.  And no one else ever came and apologized, checked on us, etc. - we also moved ourselves.  

Kudos for convenience, food is fine, but save anger towards the customers until they do something to annoy you.

Sometimes in life, you just have to punch yourself in the nuts.  

And the PBR Rock Bar & Grill is a great place for that.  You see, they have a large bar inside and a decent sized bar outside.  Happy Hour provides good drinking for cheap. (for Vegas)  Then, when it starts raining and you go inside, and the girls you're failing so miserably to pick up sit at the counter ouside of the mechanical bull, you HAVE to ride the thing to impress them.  I've ridden one before...in khakis and boxers.  Big mistake.  Anyway, you basically just get to junk punch yourself over and over until you have the worst sideache ever, or you actually fall off.  I fell off after two junk punches.  But then something funny happened.  Two shots and two beers later, I magically could feel my testicles again, and felt I needed to show off for the two girls one last time.  Plus, my friend got there and said he needed video of me junk punching myself since he wasn't there the first time.  So, back on it and this time I said, "Take the pain!  Take the pain!"  And I did...for far too long, until I got 360'd at a very high rate of speed and flew 20 feet.

I'm not sure if the girls were impressed, (doubt it) but my friend bought me a drink.

The end.

We dined at PBR Rock Bar & Grill as part of a dinner and show package with Vegas! The Show. There were several choices for us on the fixed price menu and we both ended up choosing the pulled pork sandwich. I was originally going to try the chicken pasta dinner but our server said it is so super spicy that he always steers people away from it. I like a little spice but not too much so I appreciated that advice. He also let me know that the menu was outdated and the dessert choice of the warm chocolate chip cookie with ice cream was much smaller than before and only had one scoop of ice cream. That was fine and I was thankful for the heads up. The food was good but we were traveling and attending the show right after so we were not able to take our leftovers home. There were a couple of drawbacks to our experience. The music was super loud and we were not able to really talk to each other. The server attempted to get a second tip from us and we are generous tippers but we knew that the gratuity was included with our dinner and show package.

Great place to look at and great atmosphere, but the main meals were all cold when they arrived at the table. Our beer that we ordered was room temperature and quite disappointing. I wouldn't recommend dining here if you're looking for hot food and cold drinks.

There are plenty of options in the Miracle Mile Shops to eat, ended up going here. Did not regret that actually, it's a nice bar to be in any case, but also the choice of food is very nice. Was very hungry and had a philli the Chili bowl.....wow, what a great Chili and more than enough. We been a few times all was good .this review is from a little while back  going get them on here

Let me start by saying that had I known PBR is the acronym for Professional Bull Riding, we would not have ended up here (that makes me think 'country music' rodeo, etc which I have no interest in whatsoever) - but I'm so glad we did!!! 

We were exhausted, didn't care to walk much, & hangry on Sunday night of a holiday weekend when we found ourselves at Miracle Mile. We chose this spot off the directory not wanting greasy fast food but also wanting a decent meal in a casual atmosphere. 

We were seated immediately next to the bar area and behind some retail racks which was cool - we could people watch the foot traffic entering Miracle Mile from the strip and also could listen to the DJ & MC while watching the numerous drunk brides-to-be ride the bull as they mimicked riding their man only to be thrown face first from the bull - it was loud but some good entertainment!! And the music wasn't country either, for which I was pleasantly surprised. We also enjoyed watching the DJ pretend he was working hard mixing the music when the pop music playing was just the straight tracks LOL

Our party of 3 ordered ribs, a sandwich, & the ribeye. The food was good but the ribeye, although tasty, was surprisingly a bit tough (probably the worst ribeye had in a long time). We enjoyed the free glasses for ordering a particular size brew and shake - & took advantage leaving with our souvenirs. 

Service was good.  I rarely pay so IDK about value of our meal but the shake in souvenir glass was $14.95 O_O. The Nutella shake was good & even came with a full size sprinkled donut adorning the straw, but $14.95?  A lil pricey if you ask me. Oh, & there's only 4 shake flavors, not the long list as displayed on the menu at the front near the hostess (disappointing).

All in all it was a good, entertaining choice & worth the experience.  If we ever go back, we'll just have to step it up and ride that bull ;D

Great burgers and great service, we sat outside and our server was Rome he is so genuine, and friendly. I ordered something that I didn't like he did not even hesitate to take it back and put in a rush order. Awesome guy

Everytime I'm in vegas I make it a priority to come get this iced tea alcoholic beverage they have.

It's so freaking good. You just drink drink drink drink it and you don't know you're getting drunk. Be careful because it creeps up on you slowly!

I've also had a pulled sandwich from here that was delicious!

Definitely what I expected from a sports bar...lots of TVs...all showing March Madness. They have a bull riding station and beer pong for all the beer drinking, rodeo studs out there. All this makes for a somewhat raucous atmosphere.

The food was really tasty. I highly recommend the penny butter and Jelly wings as well as the spicy cheese wings for appetizers. I promise you won't be disappointed. 

I had the Jalepeno burger and Cheryl had the pulled pork sandwich. There was so much pulled pork on that sandwich that she took half of it back to the room. 

They have a ton of drink specials as well. Too many to go in to details.

This was by far the worst meal I had the whole week I was in vegas...they didn't offer most of the food their online menu showed saying they just opened...the food we did order off the limited menu was horrible, chicken strips that were smaller than popcorn bites and overcooked to a teeth cracking level, a sausage patty that was more like a hockey puck the English muffin was soggy with grease to where I couldn't even eat it, also breaded fish that was 90% breading 1% fish...don't waste your money

This was the worst experience I had in Las Vegas. We waited 45 minutes our server never showed up. A party came in after us and they got waters and served right of way. was it because we were Latinos and the other party white  never coming back.

This place could easily have 4+ stars if they had better service. The portions are really large and filling and great quality too. I ordered a steak salad. Steak was cooked and seasoned to perfection and the salad was enormous. The atmosphere is great, the facility is clean, the restaurant has a nice consistent theme, great seating both indoors and outside. Our server was nice but she rarely visited our table, took about 20 minutes to refill our water and get us some ranch for the salad, and basically disappeared after we got our food. After waiting for a while longer we actually had to go look for her to get our check. The other servers looked bored and uninterested. You'd be surprised how much more people would pay for good services!
The wife and I were looking for some BBQ and stopped in here. The food was awesome. Our server was awesome. Thank you for showing us a great eating experience.

I love the PBR Rock Bar & Grill!
Besides the friendly service, the location is a huge plus!
We sat outside and had a great spot to watch the people going by.
I had an egg & cheese sandwich with fries which was good but nothing special. Combined with a PBR it makes a real good meal. Especially because the price was pretty decent for Las Vegas. 
We visited in the afternoon and various seats were taken. I could imagine it being crowded and party-like at night, because they offer drinking games like beer pong and others.
Over all I really enjoyed my visit and would definitely come back again!
The food probably tastes better after a few drinks. My steak was overlooked, spinach had too much raw garlic in it  and onion strings were greasy. They get a star because the server was nice.

Service was very slow and he screwed up our ordered three times cause he wasn't listening. We only had two appetizers so it wasn't that hard to get right.  The food was low quality. We had fries and wing and some how the wings were sweet and sour not buffalo. The fries were some how soft ? I would go way out if my way not to go here again
Great place to come as a stop for bar hopping.  Haven't had the food here but the drinks are good.  Music isn't bad either.  When I cam here on a Friday night, there was hip hop playing.

I ate here because the line at Earl of sandwich was really long and I was starving. I should have waited in line. This place wasn't horrible by any means it just wasn't great. I had the field greens salad with goat cheese which would have been great if it was drenched which dressing which over powered all the other flavours. They also really need to get new menus they are so old and warm that they are kind of hard to read.

Unfortunately our experience at this bar was pretty bad. We ordered de queso con carne appetizer and it was truly disgusting! There was literally two tablespoons of grease floating on top of the cheese. The service was really mediocre, we saw our waitress, the manager and a bus-person passing by our table, but no one was willing to refill our drinks. It literally took 20 minutes to get more soda. For my entree I got the mac and cheese and it was pretty bland. The only good part about my visit was the warm cookie appetizer which was delicious! Overall, the bar has a great atmosphere, I just wish the food an
Extremely loud, but the food was good and the drinks delicious..  Services was above average but seemed short staffed

Nice atmosphere.  Just what my wife and I were expecting.  Good place for food and to watch the game with plenty of beers and cocktails.  I had the buffalo chicken sandwich.  It looked like it may have been hand breaded fried chicken, but I could be wrong about that.  It tasted great nonetheless.  However the drizzle of buffalo sauce was disappointing.  I had to request extra buffalo sauce to be able to taste it.  The food was very good.

There is no guarantee of tomorrow. It is so important to make the most of each day and night. My dear friend Christie and I made the most of last Friday night when we met her lifelong friends at PBR Rock Bar.

   From a local's perspective, driving to PBR Rock Bar is a nightmare. It is not like the Voodoo Lounge or Level 107 Lounge where you pull in from a 4-lane arterial into a well designed parking garage. The local has to maneuver through the mayham of the Strip area traffic. The worst part is maneuvering through the Planet Hollywood/Miracle Mile parking garage. It is a poorly designed parking lot without notice that the motorist is driving the wrong way. Once the local finds the parking spot, it is a walk through the corridors of Miracle Mile at Planet Hollywood to reach PBR Rock Bar where the mall touches the Las Vegas Strip. Now, If your vacationing on the Strip, PBR Bar is a short walk off the sidewalk.

  PBR Rock Bar is really two different bars under one business. You have the indoor bar and nightclub overlooking the mall and the outdoor bar and nightclub patio overlooking the mid Strip. This is where the high energy is. When you look up you could see the Cosmopolitan tower, when you look straight you see a Las Vegas Strip bordered by Planet Hollywood and the Cosmopolitan. In the near distance the intermittent Bellagio Fountains dance and the Eiffel Tower stands tall. In the near distance, the sidewalks are prime people watching. Looking into the bar, there stands the mechanical bull. The mechanical bull is really a symbol of their business practice. They really take the customer for a ride by charging different prices for the exact beverage. That is bull!  In hindsight I regret not riding the mechanical bull. I think it would of been a lot of fun. In reality, my eyes and attention were on my company. The volume of the music was at a decibel where we could hear one another. Christie and I started out in the indoor bar. When you arrive from the Planet Hollywood parking garage, you enter through the indoor bar. From this angle, the outdoor patio is camouflaged by a wall and dim interior. After Christie's friends called her we'd find our way to the outdoor patio. This is where we'd spend around 3 hours of our lives.

    There is an admission price for guys. Even guys who drink girl drinks :-). The admission is $10. But it includes a drink. For the Las Vegas Strip this is a decent deal. The average drink on the Las Vegas Strip is $12. And if I'm not mistaken, a 22 ounce beer upstairs in Twin Peaks is $10. Once your in the bar, a click on the Yelp application illuminates the buy one get one free drink check-in. The average drink is around $12. By the conclusion of the 3 drinks, people ought to be up in Space Mountain-a state of a nice relaxing buzz.

    By the time I drank the three drinks, I was up in Space Mountain enjoying a nice relaxing buzz. I enjoyed two Blue Hawaiins and a Bahamas Mama. Supposedly they are girl drinks. But I got to be a man and tell the truth. They were delicious but nothing spectacular. The bartenders didn't even bother to add a maraschino cherry. They came in a plastic cup. They were a delicious route to get to Space Mountain. They taste like fruit punch with alcohol. Now high up in Space Mountain,  I thought I was being funny and managed to drink Christie's Whiskey Neat. I am no connoisseur on whiskey, but it was decent and put me to the summit of Space Mountain. When I brought Christie, a replacement Whiskey Neat I was incognizent to the idea that the bartender charged different prices for the exact drink. I'd end the night with the least expensive beer. It was PBR. Although I was in no state to keep track of the price, I think it was $5.

  Now back to Earth and off Space Mountain,  when I reflect on PBR Rock Bar, I see 3 stars. I dislike the inconsistency in price. However, there is a high energy level to the place. Its setting on the Las Vegas Strip in the shadow of the Cosmopolitan Tower and in the sightlines of The Bellagio Fountains and Eiffel Tower is high energy. $25 for a nice buzz is a good deal. Most of all I enjoy the memories of spending three hours here with my friend and her friends.
We loved it. Food was great and drinks were good. The server was quick and nice. Good view and the fire pit tables were cool. We will be back.

These nachos are NOT the business.  Okay, yes, I'm a bit of a nacho connoisseur...I'm picky and I can't stand fake cheese...but these are really terrible.

The food at this place is like an even more mediocre "Chili's."  Unimpressive to say the least, and overpriced to boot.

The environment can be fun with the right group though - they've got a bull for riding, so there's that.  Ultimately, if you've got a bucking bull, beer pong, and the right group of people, it's hard to not have a good time.

While in Vegas over this past weekend we visited this bar. Let me say they have amazing food here! Buy one get one free great mixed drinks! The fries they have I forgot what they were called but omgodness!!!! This place is also a club at night and plays great music a lot of hip hop and top 40's. They also have beer pong lol Super fun place with great food!

Service great! Fun staff even at 330 am there still friendly and ready to have fun with the customer. 
The food is amazing! I tried the blacken cajun fettuccine. . OMG SO FREAKING GOOD !! Season very well , huge portion, and  flavorful

Went on a Monday night for free entry and $25 for all you can drink, which was a fantastic deal.  We also tried beer pong, which was fun but being from Britain we don't play often and got eliminated first.

The bar service was very quick and friendly, and we managed to drink plenty until closing time.  This was on a Monday night though, and therefore it was quieter.
Its like we all know PBR is not that good of beer but this place is a pretty cool spot to chill. There is alot of stuff happening around you and There chicken waffles seemed like a good size portion.

Good!
Fast service, nice people. 2 pints for only 6 dollars & the pulled pork sandwich was excellent. Nothing fancy but well done!

Service was good and the women are very attractive but don't order the chicken fajitas. Not very authentic and did not taste very good overall. My girl got the salmon salad and it was a lot better. I would give them another chance but make sure you order something that is not healthy and it will probly be good.

This place GREATLY surpassed our expectations. We are frequent visitors to Vegas as we used to be locals. Usually when you visit a place like this, you expect over priced and corny with sub par food. Was it the best food we've ever had? No, but very, very good and relatively cheap. 2 beers, 4 drinks, 5 entrees and an appetizer for $99. The check-in option for BOGO drinks was awesome! Only complaint was it was incredibly loud, however if we had waited to be sat outside that wouldn't have been an issue!

This place is SO awesome, I have to "re Yelp" it. I was there several times during my annual Vegas summer trip and the food, and customer service is great. This year was a special Vegas trip, as we got engaged!! (at Freemont St though,  not here. Lol). Trying to stay on my health kick, I ordered a salad there. I can't remember the name, but it was a gamechanger. It was romaine lettuce, tomato, cucumbers, but THEN it got sexy and ADDED pulled pork, bacon, bbq chicken, brisket... O M G. There are no words. Never in my life have  I torn through a SALAD AND went back at the end of our trip to have it AGAIN!! The staff was as sweet as their tea is. No complaints. First stop off the plane next summer when we fly to LV to get married!!

If you want to talk to a hostess and be ignored and shrugged off, THIS IS THE PLACE FOR YOU! No seating outside or estimated wait. We were sat inside for breakfast with strobe lights in our face, our server was super nice closed the sliding doors, the hostess came over 1 min later and opened it even further than it was before, said it needs to stay open, and when we tried to talk to her she waived us off and walked away. They made us move tables, said we probably can't keep the same server even though we had already ordered. The  manner in which they handled the situation made us feel like pests. The food was average. Nothing to write home about or go back to, but edible for sure.

Moral, if you are looking for a dirty party. Probably a great place, if you're looking for a meal and service, keep looking.

My husband and I are "Henderson" locals and decided to do a "staycation" for 2 nights at Planet Hollywood for our anniversary! On the 2nd night we brought our kids up for dinner and decided to eat at Rockbar! We had a great time! Such a fun place, great atmosphere, great staff and my 10 year old son had a blast on the mechanical bull... Our waitress Joanna C made this night extra special and super fun for all of us! Plus the food is out of this world... Pulled pork fajitas were delicious and the fact that they still serve pancakes for dinner was a total win for my kids of course! Lol!

My girlfriends and I have gone here 3 times and all 3 times we have had such an amazing time! We got seated right away, the servers are super nice and become your friend the first conversation!:] 
I love every moment of it the restaurant! 
There pia colada is so delicious!!!

I had dinner here with my husband last night. We both had margaritas, which were decent but nothing special. I had the PBR burger. I asked for it medium, but it came out pretty rare. Overall, it was a very average burger and I should have added bacon to it. My husband had the BBQ burger. It had a lot going on with the burger, pork, bacon and onion rings. His also came out pretty rare for medium. The service was not great.
Service is good, a/c on the inside is acceptable, food comes out in timely manner..the burger is good, no great, but all washed down with a beer works out just fine on a 110 degree day.
Meh....  Wings were eh...  And fries were decent  nothing to write home about....  Good service though...  Waiter was cool.

We were all getting hungry around midnight so we found PBR which was still service food. We were entertained by the people riding the mechanical bull. As for the food:
Chili sliders: 2/5 messy and did not taste that great. Bf had to eat most of it. 
Potato salad: 3/5 potatoes were hard...
Chicken wings: 5/5 yummy!!!
Can't believe what I heard the waiters said to the people in the next booth with a tv  . she told them that if they don't keep ordering drinks that she would kick them out of the Booth .

Avoid this place if you can! They completely ruined our bachelorette dinner & my Friday evening! I ended up having a graphic evening in the restroom rather than an amazing night at the Backstreet Boys concert from this place! Service was a disaster. The little machines they use to place your order suck, the server sent half of the groups food in order In and not the others so half the table ate before the other half. Our drinks came out the same way. It was at least 10 minutes before my jack/coke came. 20 minutes to get a plain soda for the pregnant friend. A drink was spilled at the table and we all cleaned it up with our napkins, the staff didn't even notice. No silverware was given with our food. Getting the check was a nightmare. The food came out cold and we were so hungry and hurried we had to scarf it down. I ended up sick from the worst food poisoning I've ever had after eating here. I had the fried Mac/cheese balls, 1 portion of the chicken quesadilla & a salad with chicken. All tasted nasty and old by the time it came to the table. I wish I had just stayed hungry, wound have saved my night.

Nicely located attached to Planet Hollywood. Came in at dinner time and was seating immediately. Good for me probably not so good for them but it was a Thursday night. Place was clean, service was good, and food was good. Typical franchise experience. I got the jerk burger. Nice and spicy.
Breakfast was cheap and decent I didn't have any drinks here so I cant rate that. Not one of the best places for a quick bite to eat but it will do the trick.

Came in because the bf and I were hungry, and the line for earls was wayyy too long. Got seated pretty quick. It's a bar restaurant so it was pretty loud. There's a bull you can ride near the front. We got our food pretty quick and it wasn't bad. I thought the prices were okay considering everything is $$ in Vegas. However, it took wayyy too long and wayy too many reminders from another waiter in order to get our check from our waitress. I wouldn't mind coming back but it's not my favorite.

Eh. We were hard-pressed to find somewhere to grub at 3am after leaving the club, so we settled for PBR. The music was waaaaay too loud and the food was overpriced Applebee's. The waitstaff was super-friendly, though service was painfully slow. Two of our girls fell asleep before their food arrived.

This is where I get my yardstick every time! I really like their flavors and mix hurricane with coral crush. For some reason I think it tastes better than Fat Tuesday, especially when more shots are added in. I have also tried their food. It's not bad for bar food and the portions are pretty big.

Ok, so honestly I haven't eaten here. I actually walk up to their little outside bar and order me a frozen strawberry daiquiri. I've been here a few times now for the same thing and every time I come, the drink is amazing and has a good amount of alcohol in it. Of course I add an additional shot to mine for an extra kick but it's a pretty good drink. I'd say the size right below a yard is like $14 (somewhere around that). It's worth it.

my only reason for coming to this place was to get a green guitar filled with a blended drink for new years. 

so, a few of us were on the strip around 6:30. the rest of the group wasnt gonna be around until 8:30, so we walked from cosmo to ph to grab a guitar. we stood at the daiquiri bar and waited maybe 5 minutes for anyone to even acknowledge we were there. mind you, it was still pretty early and wasnt really busy yet. one of the bartenders asks me what i want, i order a guitar, and ask if theres a green one (i got the last one!). i order the tropical (i think thats what i was called) one and decline the extra shot for $2 (it was still pretty early and i wanted to make it til midnight). she doesnt even card me! i had my card out and was waiting for her to ask me for it, but she didnt. (slightly insulted? yes. i'm 25 but i dont look it. and its NYE! i wonder who else she sold alcohol to...). i paid, i tasted it (it tasted like a big stick popsicle!), and i was stuck wearing this guitar all night. 

needless to say, i've experienced better service. much rather go to fat tuesdays!!! and - i ended up getting annoyed with the damn thing and left it at chandelier bar.

Came here a couple of times for a lunch and I got some toasts.
I would say they were pretty good of compared to the average standard around. 
So I would go there for a quick bite again
Vicki and Sammy went out of thier way to make a really awful experience with a promoter better. You ladies rock! Thx a million

Fun place, the beer is not bad. I'm not a fan of PBR but when it's on tap,cold,keep pouring them,its that good. FOOD size is plenty I went for the Mac and cheese w/bacon our guest had ribs,sausages, somekind beef and more beer. Yup would hang out here again.

Great location, Great appetizers & Cocktails! Love the outdoor seating.Flat screens everywhere. I went during the week & it was still a good size crowd. I love the atmosphere but I never stay too long. Tourist can get wild & crazy but its expected so if your a local do what you got to do & enjoy the night life. Than keep your ass moving to the next place. Oh ya try Riding the Bull you may make it home that night lmao...I recommend PBR to everybody try it out, you wont be dissapointed! FUN FUN FUN ;-)
Garbage food. Garbage service. Overpriced. Took 45 minutes to bring us our food. 50$ for sandwiches I prolly could make better if I made them myself

We stopped by on Thursday night for a drink, we got a perfect spot on the patio at the bog circle table. As the guests were leaving one of them said "If you want service, you should go to another bar" We just sat sown anyway...for 10 minutes and not 1 person talked to us or even said that they will be right with us. Only 1 guy came and cleared the table. We sat for 10 minutes and then left. 4 people that worked there saw us leave but didn't say anything. Oh well their loss it was my sisters 30 bday and we were ready to party!

The food at PBR is not by any means healthy, but oh so good. We were seated promptly and catered by multiple servers and bussers who were very attentive. We ordered the fried pickles as an appetizer. These were by far the best fried pickles I have ever had! We were so tempted to order more before our meals came! My boyfriend and I split a jalapeo cheeseburger and the taco salad. The burger was cooked perfectly and had great seasoning. The meat was very good. The taco salad was incredible! Not healthy at all but so addictive! What happens in Vegas right? The atmosphere of PBR was casual and fun! Everyone was having a good time! They have picnic tables made to look as if you are eating outside and a mechanical bull that you can ride if you dare! They also have a nice bar attached to the side where you can chill out, play giant jenga and order more drinks after dinner. This is a great casual place to visit in Las Vegas where all feel they are welcome.
burgers were amazing and our waitress was so nice. there was a beer pong place inside and a bull it was awesome to hang out and its very laid back and chill for being on the strip.

Horrible service.  We asked for split bills at the beginning ...they couldn't do it?!?!? Been here twice first time drinks took about 15-20 minutes when we were about the only people there.  Second time food came fast just management and staff are clueless.  Place to avoid.

Not impressed, ordered California burger,  asked for no onions but the Guacamole had onions...... They should toast their buns, it would make the burgers  taste better. I told the waiter but he said I asked for no onions, he should have known the guacamole had them. Also, he didn't know how to redeem a yelp free drink coupon, we also had to ask for our waiter since he never came back to check on us or to take our other drink order. Took almost 10 mins to get a 16oz PBR!

I usually don't take the time to write a review, but I have no problem making time for this place. 

I was traveling from out of town with a group of about 25 people to Las Vegas from Southern California. We visit Vegas twice a year as a group and wanted to change up our normal routines to something different. We were excited to give this place a try. About half of our group arrived early and was greeted at the door by someone with wristbands for $5 drinks and free mechanical bull ride with receipt of your first drink. Awesome right? We thought so... so we all get our wristbands, buy a round of drinks and settle in to this completely empty bar looking forward to the night ahead. After about 10 minutes in the bar changed bartenders, we went up for drinks and the bartender informed us that our wristbands were no good and that it was only for women. No problem, this wasn't going to ruin our night. So one of the girls in the group goes to buy a drink as well as a round for her boyfriend. The bartender notices that she's buying a drink for herself and for one of the men and immediately becomes confrontational with the female. She then proceeds to slam the register drawer shut and toss the pen on to the bar. At this point we request the manager who comes out to try and calm the situation down and explains that there was a mix up and they would not be honoring the wristbands for the men but would honor it for the women. 

Moments later, the bartender becomes confrontational with one of the women again and then begins using outrageous and unprofessional language at the group. We obviously at this point decided to leave, so we briefly waited outside in the main hall for the rest of the group to arrive as well as for food that had been ordered. A security guard is then sent to the door and enters the hallway where he says that we will have to move on somewhere else.

I can't even say enough bad things about this place and our experience here. Was literally the worst half hour we have ever had in Las Vegas and I'm still in disbelief at how disrespected a group of 25 paying customers would be treated, especially considering the whole problem was originally stemmed from their own mistake. It's clear to me why this place was empty on a Saturday night in Las Vegas.

Housed in the former Hawaiian Tropic space it appears that not much has changed on the service front. We stopped by for happy hour which included $3 domestic drafts and had to practically shoot a gun in the air to get a bartenders attention. With the exception of the lack of bikinis, the bartenders are just as inattentive, robotic and surly as the former bartenders at HT. With cheap beer flowing like water on the strip there is really no reason to visit the PBR again.

Came here for lunch on monday (our first full day in Vegas.) Decently priced, HH 2 for 1 drinks & our burgers were delicious! Plus Mac & cheese with Doritos on top!? Hangover heaven! Our servers were awesome and attentive. We will be back for sure next time!

Went in with a friend and received awesome service from Wanda. We had the buffalo wings ,half buffalo/ half bbq and fries. The food was so tasty. Wanda told us about happy hour and 3 hours later we returned with our friends. The happy hour drink specials were so good. I ended up getting 5 drinks totalling a little over $20.

We ordered the boneless buffalo wings and a shrimp and tomato appetizer. The boneless wings were dry, it could be because we were there at midnight, and the shrimp appetizer could have had more shrimp lol. I would give them another chance. The live band was nice and we sat outside which was perfect!
Wr bought a Show/Dinner Package and had to choose from a limited menu.  Food was okay, service was great!

Like the atmosphere, but all the food is comfort food and is decent.  The buffalo wings were really good though.  Drink prices are expensive.  Lots of people riding the bull.  They have a outside patio which is nice.

Haven't tried the food just yet, we all came in just for the chance to give our bachelorette the opportunity to do some bull riding!! haha.. It was fun that they actually had one here on the vegas strip, very convenient for things like that :) we had an awesome time watching our bachelorette riding the bull hahaha.. next time, we gotta try the food to match :)
I've always liked this place and we always come back here. Pretty standard for food and everything. Nothing spectacular but the place is just cool!

I've been to vegas a million times but never really ate at one of the places on the strip.  This past time my friend and i were walking the strip and picked this place bc we were starving, and didnt really want to walk around anymore.  what a good pick it was.  I think he had a pulled pork sandwich.  I had the country fried chicken sliders.  everything was delicious.  from the first bite of the biscuits to the last bite of the fries.  and the prices werent bad either.  plus they had a mechanical bull.  that was unexpected, and entertaining to watch as always.

It's Vegas so it's pretty loud:) It's not very healthy food but it was good. The service was very nice. The have a mechanical bull which was fun to watch:) We had a few sandwiches like the grilled chicken melt. Greasy but yummy:) It comes with a side like potato salad which was also good.

Found this place by reading reviews on good restaurant preferably with country atmosphere/nice outdoor patio and this place nailed it! Huge patio right on the strip with outdoor heaters and fire pits! I was super happy we got a very nice table right next to the strip with a fire pit in the center! It was amazing. The food was delicious! I had the chicken nachos and most of our party head the steak and eggs! It was all great food and service. We had a blast and I'm so glad we came here!! Check it out!
About as mediocre as you can get.  Mechanical bull/ sports bar/ loud music/ etc.  Bland, boring American cuisine.  There are plenty of better options in Las Vegas.

We ate here based on location and the cool looking fire pits outside.  I would recommend you use more logical decision making when choosing a place to eat!  The hostesses at the hostess stand inside had no clue.  The first one told us there was no open seating outside.  The second one said she didn't handle outside seating and there was a different hostess outside we needed to see.  We went outside and were seated next to one of the long fire pits, which was nice since it was a little chilly.  Service was pretty bad, we had to flag someone down after 8 minutes or so to get our food ordered.  I ordered the blackened chicken fettucine and the bf ordered the chili cheese dog.  

Shortly after we ordered, they had an issue with the fire pits and had to keep lighting and relighting them, leaning over various customers and their tables.  Our food took a little long to come out, but was right when it did.  It was average tasting, nothing worth coming back for.  The blackened chicken fettucine was spicy, as promised by the menu.  The chili dog was huge!  My two cents are to try someplace of which you might have higher expectations.

The bucking bull fries are undoubtably the best thing I've ever eaten, EVER! The service was sub-par but the delicious food made up for it. I live in So. Cal but will be coming back solely for the food.

All I have to say is B-E-S-T french fries! Like, literally, the best. I wish I could have some right now, but unfortunately there is no PBR Rock Bar in Boston. Their crunchy slaw is pretty damn good as well, and they have some great drink specials.
So far i'm an hour in still waiting on one grilled chicken sandwich! My friend is waiting on a salad! And no explanation from the waitress for the wait.

Food was okay, service was horrible! So many workers and no one there to help you, get a table or take your order! If the place was packed, I would understand but it wasn't, not even close! When we finaly did go seat our SELVES, we waved down a waitress after 30 mins waiting! UGH! Then we tryed to use the 2 for 1, which they told us, only work at the bar! WHAT! Lame! wont be back!

Pass by this place pretty often due to it's proximity to earls. On the outside they sell tall cups and novelty drink holders filled with some kind of alcoholic slurpy. The most expensive thing is the guitar which was $40 if memory serves right, and the smallest cup was something between $10-$16. I don't know exactly how many ounces is in each one of those but I can tell you it's a lot. Throw in a couple of extra shots in each and it'll mess even some heavy weights. 

We went in and tried a bunch of different foods. The food was pretty good, although we were all pretty hammered so there's a high probability it's a lot worse than how I remember it.

Inside the men's restroom was Mexican Wolverine, I shit you not.

F this place. Just got to Vegas for the first time, so my friends and I were vey excited for our first meal and beer after the long plane ride.  The outdoor seating was appealing, and we were just looking for an easy lunch.  There were a few tables visibly available, but there was the hostess had no idea what was going on.  We stood there for 10 minutes, but it was clear this place was so unorganized. I wish we turned  back at that point.  

A server didn't approach us for at least 20 minutes. When she did, she didn't apologize for the wait, and was quite rude. The four of us each got a beer, and ordered immediately because it had taken so long already. She forgot half our drinks, which literally took another 20 minutes.

The food took 40 minutes to come out.  Of course, my plate had a 6-inch black curly hair on half of my plate, which was the icing on the plate.  The waitress saw me look in disgust, and it was impossible to miss as it was on top of my eggs/bacon.  I normally don't send back, but I really wanted to.  However, I did not because we would have still been there. So I took one for the team, kept my plate, and ate about 2 bites as I instantly lost my appetite even though I was ravenous.  So yeah- 2 hours, awful service, awful food, and a nice big long hair in my food.

Avoid at all costs. Worst place ever.
Our service was horrible. Our waiter went missing for 45 minutes and we finally found him flirting with bar tender. The food was decent rather have had McDonald's.

That' an awesome place to having fun. You can chill outside the terrace or go inside with great music, a bar and beerpong tables. As we spent our times we go several times to PBR. 

The food is very good and they serve a wide choice of diffrent meals. (Burgers, pizza, wings and ribs). Staff was always friendly and helpful. 

I can hardly recommand this place. You can have lunch or dinner, go for a good pre-party or just chill outside and looking at the strip. We will definatly turn back here asap. ;)
Wow, busy place!  Lots of bar space, good place to hang out and drink. Drew is the best bartender!!

This place is full of shit. It was 4 of us in a group, and they give us the smallest table in the place. It was so small that we had to put menus that stayed on the table on the floor so we could have a spot to eat at. I asked the hostess for the booth and she said that it was for the larger parties. I'm looking like what the fuck are we.  I ordered the whole BBQ rib fries and onion rings. When they put the rib on the table, I could not believe that this rib was white!!!!!  White as if they had but it in a pot and boiled it! It didn't look like it was bbq at all. I got the manager, and he said it looked like that because he ran out of hickory wood chips.!!!!! I guess he thought we couldn't tell the difference between a BBQ rib and a one that was boiled. Then after all that complaining, we look over and that empty booth was being occupied by..... You guessed it, a party of 4! Well I guess if we would of been any blacker, we would had to eat by the dumpster...... I sat in disbelief to see a waiter walk buy with.......... Ooooohhhhh yeah, you guessed it. A BBQ rib that was cooked the right way. You know, that wasn't boiled and didn't gave the same complexion as Michael Jackson. That rib the waiter had look just the the picture on the menu. I can not believe the service here at this place. I just wanted to take my wife  on a decent place for b-day. Fuck this shit hole!! If I could give this place no stars I would. The hostess, and manager can take that one star that they sure as hell don't deserve and stick it up their ass till it reach the back of their teeth. Fuck off!

Good American Bar food (my favorite) at a reasonable price. The food itself was decent,not spectacular. I prefer my fried pickles in chips instead of spears but hey its all preference. Chili tater tots were pretty good, French fries are good. Server was really nice ans low pressure. He let us sample the drink flavors before we got a souvenir drink and was helpful/efficient. All in all, a good spot right on the strip that wasn't too crowded!

We ate here on a Saturday night and the service was not great but not too bad. The bull riding was fun. The fried pickles are not good but the chicken tenders were on point. I would probably not go back or recommend just because they are so many other places that are very similar with above average service.

I have been to PBR Rock Bar & Grill twice.  The first time, we had five different servers over the course of our meal, had to wait an hour for the food to come out, then had to send it back three different times because it wasn't right.  And we ordered chili dogs.  Really?

The second time, we actually intended to go to Earl of Sandwich, but their registers were malfunctioning so they couldn't take orders.  Starving, we ended up back at PBR.  We were seated promptly, but then we sat for a total of twenty minutes without one server even looking our way.  The place wasn't exactly packed either, and all the servers were just standing around watching someone ride the electric bull.  When I walked out, I let the hostess know that we had been sitting for a long time with no service.  Her response?  She just laughed hysterically.  Umm, that's not an appropriate reaction to a customer complaint.

I really love this place! We were searching for a place to eat and stumbled across this bar/grill located inside the Planet Hollywood.

We were seated at our table and were surprised that the table had its own TV to watch the game on plus a plug/charging port for your devices. Our server Kole stopped by our table a couple of minutes after we sat down and immediately took our drink order.

I cannot emphasize enough how fast the service is here. We received our food about 15 minutes after ordering.

I ordered the Triple Turkey Club which was incredible. I have never had a sandwich with so much flavor. The turkey tasted as though it was just carved and it was so flavorful. I ordered fries with a side of cheese sauce. The cheese sauce was so creamy and flavorful as well.

My husband ordered the California Club and a side of Mac n' Cheese. He loved his dish as well. The portions are large, so we were really stuffed.

All in all this is a great little spot and I really enjoyed my food. Highly recommend.

Never got served. We were greeted by. Girl leaning up against the wall there was nobody at the hostess stand we were seated and nobody ever came to the table. It appeared we were the only one with this problem the table next to us had 12 people at their table and they mentioned to the manager that they had been waiting over 30 minutes and no one had ever stopped by their table. If I could give it zero stars I would. Will never be back. Too bad I couldn't review the food.

Went here on a late Friday evening looking for grub and drinks since we were staying at PH. We came across this place and checked it out. Our medium sized group sat at a nice large table near the main bar. TVs available all around. Sports on TV we're nearly over and there wasn't too busy of a crowd. 

We ordered drinks, a few appetizers and an entree. I got the hot wings which had a nice kick to them. Nothing much to complain on the food, it was satisfying. Drinks were good, shots were nearly doubles. If you're feeling whimsical, check out their specialty drinks. My cousin tried the Hat Bender and it tasted like a watermelon Jolly Rancher. :)

This place was pretty chill when we went. I'm sure if there were games playing this would be bumpin'. There's also a mechanical bull controlled by an employee. 

Overall a cool experience. Service was friendly and attentive. I wouldn't mind coming back again. Atmosphere was of a sports bar/western feel.
Sunday nights open bar for 10 bucks! Good times!

I really enjoyed this location right in Planet Hollywood. Looking for a quick but tasty bite to eat,  stop here!! I had the Smoking Jerk Burger which has a spicy little kick to it (with pineapple on it) and some fries. Burger was very delicious!! Wings were good too. 

What I really enjoyed about my experience here was the waiter we had. A very nice energetic young lady who was nice & very attentive. She made it a great experience and overall ambiance was cool; tv's to watch all the games on.

Service was so good here I came back the very next day because I knew the food would be good and the service as well.  Free bull ride available as too.

This is the first place we noticed when we arrived in Planet Hollywood for our stay. Rock bar, bull ride, beer pong & flip cup, sounded like our kind of place & we intended to hang out there a bit. Unfortunately we didn't quite have as much free time as anticipated on our holiday as Vegas just seems to eat the hours away.

We did get in there for a bite to eat one day though. It's one of the few places we came across with free wifi for customers which was a massive plus for us since we hadn't been in touch with anyone online all week. The other thing they did, which I really liked, is when we ordered one meal & asked to split it, they actually cut the burger in half & brought it out on two separate plates. Maybe this is an american thing but I had never seen this before so it really impressed me.

It wasn't the best burger I had in the week I was in Vegas & it also wasn't the best pulled pork I've ever had (hence the 3 stars). But the sangria was good (albeit more juice than alcohol) & they also had a member of staff come take pictures of my Fianc & I and give us a small free copy of the one they took (with the option to buy the bigger ones). It was nice to get one souvenir I didn't have to pay a fortune for, even if the picture of the sandwich on the one we got was bigger than the picture of us two!
Meh. Drinks took awhile, food was pretty spare. Spinach artichoke dip was lacking any flavor. Move onto something better.

Kenley was the bomb.com
Completely genuine and runs the show like pro. 
100% recommend this place

We went late at night so it was about a 15 minute wait to get seated but that was just fine. You end of gambling or strolling around the casino for a bit so it ran by quick. 

It was a noisy place because of all the music (And for being a rockbar..country music was the last thing I was planning to hear.

The service was fast, and food was just perfect. Only thing I didn't like was the silverware in the glass jar..I didn't know if it was used or what was going on there. There was 2 knifes and a fork in the jar and I was with a friend so that wasn't going to work lol. 

When the server came back around I asked for extra silverware and she starts looking in the jar. I guess she thought they had enough in there but they didn't so she had someone come around and give us extra. 

The prices are good for the amount of food they give you and it tastes wonderful. Great place to hang with a bunch of friends.

Giant portions which makes it a good value. The potatoe skin breakfast was awesome! Get the salsa on the side. The brisket breakfast burrito missed the mark  but overall was ok. Keep your receipt and you can ride the mechanical bull for free!

If you're looking for a sports bar to watch a game, this is NOT the place!  After being told a game would be displayed on a tv after being seated, the staff struggled for 40 minutes to change the channel to the right broadcast.
